analyzed: dper na don dam par 'bras bu nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yang /

analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de dag skyed nus pa nyid kyi'o //

original: bdag nyid thob pa dag ces bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed nus pa nyid des rkyen gyi bdag nyid thob pa dag ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid thob pa dag ces bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed nus pa nyid des rkyen gyi bdag nyid thob pa dag ste /
translated: â€œHaving obtained their own natureâ€ means that they have obtained the nature of conditions by means of their capability of producing effects.

original: rkyen gang dag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid grub pa de dag ni 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i bdag nyid thob pa dag go //
analyzed: rkyen gang dag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid grub pa de dag ni 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i bdag nyid thob pa dag go //
translated: Those conditions whose own nature is established are those that have obtained the nature of being capable of producing effects.

original: don dam par rkyen nyid du khas len pas zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i bdag nyid thob pa'i rkyen de dag don dam par kho bo cag mdo sde pa dag rkyen nyid du khas len pas so //
analyzed: don dam par rkyen nyid du khas len pas zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i bdag nyid thob pa'i rkyen de dag don dam par kho bo cag mdo sde pa dag rkyen nyid du khas len pas so //
translated: â€œBecause we accept them as conditions ultimatelyâ€ means that we SautrÄntikas accept those conditions that have obtained the nature of being capable of producing effects as conditions ultimately.

original: de'i tshe na 'bras bu skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de'i tshe na 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa dag skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa de'i
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'bras bu skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de'i tshe na 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa dag skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa de'i
translated: At that time, the effect such as visual consciousness and such things as the sprout are about to arise.

original: phyir ni med pa zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: phyir ni med pa zhes mi brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not said to be nonexistent.ğŸ”½It is not existent because it has not yet arisen.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na skad cig gcig gis chod pas dngos su ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na skad cig gcig gis chod pas dngos su ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: At that time, it is not directly arisen because it is obstructed by a single moment.ğŸ”½Therefore, the refutation of the proof that we have stated does not undermine our position.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa'i gnod pa med do zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi gar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi gar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Since the effect is neither existent nor nonexistent in our system,

original: de'i phyir khyed kyi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyis la @187a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyis la @187a * //
translated: Therefore, your result would be both existent and nonexistent.ğŸ”½

original: ji skad smras pa'i bsgrub pas skyon brtag pa'i gnod pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i bsgrub pas skyon brtag pa'i gnod pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, you say, â€œThe faults of the thesis of existence and nonexistence of the effect, as stated, do not exist in our position.â€

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:ğŸ”½With regard to that examination, the author of the commentary says:

original: brtag pa de la yang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag gis smras pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi gar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i brtag pa de la yang 'grel pa byed pas /ğŸ”½med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: brtag pa de la yang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag gis smras pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi gar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i brtag pa de la yang 'grel pa byed pas / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: â€œThe conditions are not suitable for a nonexistent object,

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis sun dbyung ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te // zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis sun dbyung ba smras pa yin no //
translated: nor are they suitable for an existent object.â€ğŸ”½This is the verse that states the refutation.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: mdo sde pas brtags pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi gar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas de la yang rkyen rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pas brtags pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi gar yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas de la yang rkyen rung ba ma yin no //
translated: The Sautrantikas say that the effect is neither existent nor nonexistent, and therefore it is not a proper condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is neither existent nor nonexistent, like something else that is neither.

original: brtag pa 'di la yang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa 'di la yang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In this analysis, the effect is neither existent nor nonexistent, and therefore it is neither.

original: des na rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is neither, is the reason.

original: de ltar 'bras bu phyogs su bya ba la de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni dpe 'gyur bas de'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu phyogs su bya ba la de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni dpe 'gyur bas de'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus, the master BuddhapÄlita intended the expression â€œlike something elseâ€ to mean â€œlike something else that is not an effect.â€

original: 'di la yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yang ma yin yod pa yang ma yin pas /ğŸ”½don dam par mig la sogs pa de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yang ma yin yod pa yang ma yin pas / don dam par mig la sogs pa de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, that which is asserted to be inexpressible as existent or nonexistent is neither nonexistent nor existent.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, those eyes, etc. are not conditions of eye consciousness, etc. and those sprouts, etc. are not conditions of their effects, because their effects are asserted to be inexpressible as existent or nonexistent.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like something else.

original: 'dir yang 'di la yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'di la yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa yang ma yin /
translated: Here, that which is asserted to be inexpressible as existent or nonexistent is neither nonexistent nor existent.

original: yod pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni chos can yin te /
translated: Since it is not existent, this itself is the subject.

original: mdo sde pas brtags pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa de 'dir chos can du bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde pas brtags pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa rnam pa gnyi ga ma yin pa de 'dir chos can du bya'o //
translated: The SautrÄntikaâ€™s assertion that the effect that is to be described as neither existent nor nonexistent is the subject here.

original: don dam par mig la sogs pa de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes @187b par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mig la sogs pa de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes @187b par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is â€œit should be understood that ultimately those eyes, etc. are not conditions of eye consciousness and those sprouts.â€

analyzed: don dam par rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid med la /
translated: The probandum is that ultimately those eyes, forms, light, space, and mental activity that are conditions of eye consciousness and sprouts are not essentially conditions of the eye consciousness and sprouts that are to be described as neither existent nor nonexistent.

analyzed: de bzhin du rkyen 'bru la sogs pa la yang 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid med par shes par bya ste zhes rgyu
translated: visual consciousness and the sprout, which cannot be said to exist or not toğŸ”½exist.ğŸ”½One should prove the refutation of the effect by saying that ultimatelyğŸ”½the conditions of the effect, such as the eye, form, light, space, and mentalğŸ”½activity, are not the conditions of the effect, such as the visual consciousness

original: dgag pa dang / don dam par rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa de dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gi rkyen ma yin
analyzed: dgag pa dang / don dam par rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa de dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gi rkyen ma yin
translated: and the sprout, which cannot be said to exist or not to exist.ğŸ”½One should prove the refutation of the conditions by saying that theğŸ”½conditions of those conditions, such as the seed, are not the conditions of the

original: la / de bzhin du de dag gi rkyen 'bru la sogs pa yang 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes 'bras bu
analyzed: la / de bzhin du de dag gi rkyen 'bru la sogs pa yang 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes 'bras bu
translated: effects, such as the visual consciousness and the sprout, which cannot be said

original: dgag pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dgag pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: to exist or not to exist.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: Because their effects are not described as existent or nonexistent. This is the probandum.

original: ci'i phyir rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid med la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid med la /
translated: Why should it be understood that those conditions such as the eye do not have the nature of conditions of the effects such as eye consciousness and sprouts,

original: rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag kyang 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag kyang 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen ma yin par shes par bya zhe na /
translated: and that those conditions such as the eye are not the conditions of those effects such as eye consciousness and sprouts?

original: rkyen de dag gi 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen de dag gi 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reason is stated: because their effects, such as eye consciousness and sprouts, are not described as existent or nonexistent.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin te /
translated: For example, it is like something else. This is the example.

original: dper na 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de las gzhan pa'i bum pa yang skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de las gzhan pa'i bum pa yang skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: For example, an effect such as an eye consciousness or a sprout is not nonexistent because it is arising, and it is not existent because it has not yet arisen.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, it cannot be said to be either existent or nonexistent.

original: rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
translated: The conditions such as the eye do not have the nature of conditions of a pot, the effect.ğŸ”½The conditions such as the eye are not the conditions of a pot, the effect.

original: rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la rkyen migğŸ”½la @188a * //
analyzed: rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rkyen mig la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la rkyen mig la @188a * //
translated: In the same way, the conditions such as the eye do not have the nature of conditions of an eye consciousness or a sprout, the effect.

original: sogs pa de dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu de dag gi rkyen kyang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa de dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / myu gu de dag gi rkyen kyang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The conditions such as the eye are not the conditions of an eye consciousness or a sprout, the effect.

original: de bzhin du dper na rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dper na rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
translated: So too, for example, in regard to those conditions such as grain, the nature of the conditions of the effect, the pot, does not exist in those conditions such as grain.ğŸ”½And those conditions such as grain are not the conditions of the effect, the pot.

original: rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen kyang ma yin pa de bzhin du rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la rkyen 'bru
analyzed: rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu bum pa'i rkyen kyang ma yin pa de bzhin du rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de dag la 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang med la rkyen 'bru
translated: So too, in regard to those conditions such as grain, the nature of the conditions of the effect, the eye consciousness and the sprout, does not exist in those conditions such as grain.

original: la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen kyang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu de dag gi rkyen kyang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: And those conditions such as grain are not the conditions of the effect, the eye consciousness and the sprout.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu snam bu dang sab ma dang rkyen rgyu spun dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu snam bu dang sab ma dang rkyen rgyu spun dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, in regard to the effect, the cloth and the blanket, and the conditions, the yarn and the reeds, and so on, one should understand in accordance with the explanation.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni don dam par mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa dag mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni don dam par mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa dag mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is: ultimately, eyes, form, light, space, and mental activity are not conditions of eye consciousness,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin te /
translated: because eye consciousness is not to be described as existent or nonexistent, like a pot.

original: ji ltar bum pa skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la /
translated: For example, because a pot is in the process of arising, it is not nonexistent.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has not arisen, it is not existent, and therefore it is not to be described as existent or nonexistent.

original: mig la sogs pa dag bum pa'i rkyen ma yin pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag bum pa'i rkyen ma yin pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as eyes and so on are not conditions of a pot, in the same way, because eye consciousness is not to be described as existent or nonexistent,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not a condition of eye consciousness.

original: de bzhin du don dam par 'bru la sogs pa dag kyang myu gu'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par 'bru la sogs pa dag kyang myu gu'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, ultimately, grains and so on are not conditions of sprouts,ğŸ”½because they are not to be described as existent or nonexistent.

original: myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: myu gu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a sprout is not described as existent or nonexistent.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like a pot, cloth, or a blanket that are different from it.

original: ji ltar bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma dag skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma dag skye bzhin pa'i phyir ni med pa ma yin la /
translated: Because a pot, cloth, and blanket are not nonexistent because they are in the process of arising,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ni yod pa ma yin pas yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and because they are not existent because they have not arisen, they are not described as existent or nonexistent.

original: 'bru la sogs pa dag bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma dag gi rkyen ma yin pa de bzhin du myu gu yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa dag bum pa dang snam bu dang sab ma dag gi rkyen ma yin pa de bzhin du myu gu yang yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as grains and so on are not conditions of pots, cloth, and blankets, so too a sprout is not described as existent or nonexistent.

original: 'bru la sogs pa dag myu gu'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa dag myu gu'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore grains and so on are not conditions of a sprout.ğŸ”½That is not an answer.

original: de ni lan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag na re /ğŸ”½'bras bu yod pa'am med par smra ba dag gi phyogs la ni /
analyzed: de ni lan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag na re / 'bras bu yod pa'am med par smra ba dag gi phyogs la ni /
translated: Sautrantikas say:

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang /
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang /
translated: The position of those who say that an effect exists or does not exist in its conditionsğŸ”½is not tenable.

original: @188b rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: @188b rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: Conditions are not suitable.

original: zhes bya ba de bden na kho bo cag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyogs la ni de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de ni lan ma yin te de ni bden pa ma yin no zhes
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bden na kho bo cag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyogs la ni de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba de ni lan ma yin te de ni bden pa ma yin no zhes
translated: If that is true, then the response that we accept that the effect is not described as existent or nonexistent is not suitable is not a response, because that is not true.

original: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: ci ste gzhan dag dbu ma pa la grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar rgol te khyed kyi lung las /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dag dbu ma pa la grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar rgol te khyed kyi lung las /
translated: If others argue that the Madhyamaka contradicts its own tenets, they say, â€œIn your scriptures it says:

original: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
translated: It does not exist in the eye or in form.

original: de gnyis bar na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis bar na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: It does not exist between those two.

original: gang du de ni gnas 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du de ni gnas 'gyur ba //
translated: Where is it that it abides?

original: de yod ma yin de med min //
analyzed: de yod ma yin de med min //
translated: It is not existent, nor is it nonexistent.

original: zhes bya bas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba yod par bstan la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba yod par bstan la /
translated: This teaches that the arising of eye consciousness exists.

original: khyed kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba med par bshad pa 'di grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo
analyzed: khyed kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba med par bshad pa 'di grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis tha snyad du yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo
translated: The opponent who is being criticized from within the text for saying that the explanation of the nonarising of the eye consciousness contradicts tenets is answered here by the author of the commentary himself.ğŸ”½

original: nyid dang bral ba'i dngos po skye ba yang grub po zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nyid dang bral ba'i dngos po skye ba yang grub po zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The Commentaryâ€™s author responds to the opponentâ€™s objection, â€œYour statement that the visual consciousness is not produced contradicts your tenet,â€ by saying, â€œThings that are devoid of intrinsic reality, such as the conventionally existent, are produced.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa las yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po thams cad skye ba yang 'grub kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pa las yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po thams cad skye ba yang 'grub kyi /
translated: All things that are not expressible as existent or nonexistent in the relative truth are produced from causes and conditions.

original: don dam par ni mi 'grub pas de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par ni mi 'grub pas de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba med de /
translated: But since they are not established in the ultimate truth, there is no contradiction with our tenets.

original: ci ste yang rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen nyid du khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste yang rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen nyid du khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, if the proponents of the two truths were to accept that conditions are the causes of existent and nonexistent effects,

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say, â€œThere is no fault as has been stated,â€

original: gcer bur rgyu ba dag las rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: gcer bur rgyu ba dag las rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag na re /
translated: then the two proponents of the thesis of nonexistence from the naked ascetics say,

original: kho bo cag gi gzhung las 'bras bu ni yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi gzhung las 'bras bu ni yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: â€œOur treatise does not state that the effect exists or does not exist.

original: med pa yang ma yin pas rnam pa gnyi gar smra bas /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pas rnam pa gnyi gar smra bas /
translated: Since we state both aspects,

original: de'i phyir / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: therefore,

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: Conditions are not tenableğŸ”½For an existent or nonexistent object.

original: zhes bya ba de 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs dang med par smra ba'i phyogs dang / gnyi ga ma yin par smra ba'i phyogs dag la ni rung gi / kho bo cag gnyi gar smra ba'i phyogs la ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i phyogs dang med par smra ba'i phyogs dang / gnyi ga ma yin par smra ba'i phyogs dag la ni rung gi / kho bo cag gnyi gar smra ba'i phyogs la ni mi rung ste /
translated: This is tenable in the context of the thesis of the existence of the effect, the thesis of the nonexistence of the effect, and the thesis of the neither existence nor nonexistence of the effect, but it is not tenable in the context of our thesis of both existence and nonexistence.

original: kho bo cag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar smra ba la rkyen rnams rung bas rkyen las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar smra ba la rkyen rnams rung bas rkyen las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Since conditions are tenable in the context of our thesis of the existence and nonexistence of the effect, the effect arises from conditions.

original: de la ci ste yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te yang 'di skad ces zer na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ci ste yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te yang 'di skad ces zer na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In response to that, the term â€œalsoâ€ is connected to â€œif someone says this.â€

original: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag / ces bya bas ni gcer bur rgyu bdag ste /ğŸ”½gang dag gcig tu 'bras bu med par smra ba yang ma yin la /ğŸ”½gcig tu 'bras bu yod par smra ba yang @189a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag / ces bya bas ni gcer bur rgyu bdag ste / gang dag gcig tu 'bras bu med par smra ba yang ma yin la / gcig tu 'bras bu yod par smra ba yang @189a * //
translated: The phrase â€œthose who speak in terms of two modesâ€ refers to the Nirgranthas.ğŸ”½They are not proponents of the nonexistence of effects in every way.

original: ma yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: ma yin pa de dag ni /
translated: They are not proponents of the existence of effects in every way.

original: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag / ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag / ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called â€œthose who speak in terms of two modes.â€

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen nyid du khas len pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir gser la sor gdub mi dmigs pa de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen nyid du khas len pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te / gang gi phyir gser la sor gdub mi dmigs pa de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The phrase â€œbecause they accept the conditions of both the existence and nonexistence of effectsâ€ indicates the following.ğŸ”½Because gold is not observed in a ring, therefore the existence of an effect does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir sor gdub la gser yod pa de'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sor gdub la gser yod pa de'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin pas /

analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga la rkyen nyid khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they accept the conditions of both the existence and nonexistence of effects.

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir dbu ma pas /ğŸ”½med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir dbu ma pas / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: then the Madhyamika would reply:ğŸ”½Conditions are not tenable

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: whether things exist or do not exist.

original: zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the fault stated does not apply to our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /ğŸ”½de dag kyang phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pas rnam pa gnyis su smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dbugs mi phyin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de dag kyang phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pas rnam pa gnyis su smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dbugs mi phyin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary states:ğŸ”½Those who propound the two extremes are not satisfied with the refutation of the two extremes.

original: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba de dag kyang bdag dang gzhan gnyis las skye ba med pa'i phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pas rnam pa gnyis su smra ba bsal zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su smra ba de dag kyang bdag dang gzhan gnyis las skye ba med pa'i phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pas rnam pa gnyis su smra ba bsal zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who propound the two extremes are not satisfied with the refutation of the two extremes because the refutation of the two extremes is taught in both of the two systems of the two extremes.

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is included in the domain of the two-fold syllogism, and because there is no inference to demonstrate that things are produced from both.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'di ltar gcer bur rgyu ba dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu gser gyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig yod pa la ni rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos te skyed pa'i byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½dper na bum pa bdag nyid yod pa la rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcer bur rgyu ba dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu gser gyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig yod pa la ni rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos te skyed pa'i byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir / dper na bum pa bdag nyid yod pa la rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos pa bzhin no //
translated: The substance of gold, which is the effect imagined by the Nirgranthas, does not exist in the present moment of itself, and it does not require conditions such as fire and charcoal, because it does not depend on the activity of production.ğŸ”½For example, the existence of a pot does not require conditions such as fire and charcoal.

original: yang na snam bu bdag nyid med pa'i rkyen ni me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na snam bu bdag nyid med pa'i rkyen ni me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Or, just as the conditions of fire and charcoal, etc., do not exist in the absence of a cloth,

original: 'bras bu gser gyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig med pa'i rkyen kyang me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin te bdag nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu gser gyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig med pa'i rkyen kyang me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin te bdag nyid med pa'i phyir /

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i rkyen nam mkha'i ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i rkyen nam mkha'i ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the conditions of the nonexistence of a sky flower are not the sky.

original: de bzhin du gcer bur rgyu ba dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu sor gdub kyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig yod pa la yang rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos te bskyed pa'i bya ba la mi ltos nga'i @189b phyir ;ğŸ”½dper na snam bu bdag nyid yod pa la rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcer bur rgyu ba dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i 'bras bu sor gdub kyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig yod pa la yang rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos te bskyed pa'i bya ba la mi ltos nga'i @189b phyir ; dper na snam bu bdag nyid yod pa la rkyen me dang sol ba la sogs pa mi dgos pa bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the conditions of fire, charcoal, and so on are not necessary for the existence of the moment of the substance of the ring of the effect imagined by the Nirgranthas, because they do not rely on the action of generation.ğŸ”½For example, the conditions of fire, charcoal, and so on are not necessary for the existence of the self of a cloth.

original: yang na sna bu bdag nyid med pa'i rkyen ni me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na sna bu bdag nyid med pa'i rkyen ni me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Or, just as the conditions of the nonexistence of the self of a cloth are not fire, charcoal, and so on,

original: 'bras bu sor gdub kyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig med pa'i rkyen kyang me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'bras bu sor gdub kyi rdzas bdag nyid kyi skad cig med pa'i rkyen kyang me dang sol ba la sogs pa ma yin te ;
translated: The effect, the substance of the ring, is not a condition of the non-existence of the self-moment, nor is it fire, charcoal, etc.

original: bdag nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not exist.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i rkyen nam mkha' ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa'i rkyen nam mkha' ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, space is not a condition of the non-existence of an imaginary flower of space.

original: dbugs mi phyin to zhes bya ba ni dbugs phyin pa'i gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs mi phyin to zhes bya ba ni dbugs phyin pa'i gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: â€œ It is not a place of reliefâ€ means it is not a place of relief.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: ji ltar rnam gnyis su smra ba dag gis brtags pa de 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa de'i phyir dbugs phyin pa'i gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam gnyis su smra ba dag gis brtags pa de 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa de'i phyir dbugs phyin pa'i gnas ma yin te /
translated: Since the two-fold theory is imagined by the proponents of the two-fold theory, it is not a place of relief because it is fearful.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa la gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dgag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa la gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dgag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the assertion of the effect as the self-existence of both is invalidated by the negation of the self-existence of both.

original: de ltar na re zhig rkyen rnams spyir dgag pa bstan nas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rkyen rnams spyir dgag pa bstan nas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Thus, having taught the general negation of conditions, he says, â€œIn this way,â€ etc.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of things

original: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist in conditions, etc.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If the thing itself does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: How can there be a different thing?

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //ğŸ”½rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin // rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: An action cannot have conditions,ğŸ”½Nor can an action be without conditions.

original: bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: Without an action, there are no conditions,

original: bya ldan yod dam 'on te na //
analyzed: bya ldan yod dam 'on te na //
translated: And with an action, what are conditions?

original: 'di dag las rten skye bas na //
analyzed: 'di dag las rten skye bas na //
translated: Since things arise in dependence,ğŸ”½They are known as â€œconditions.â€

original: de phyir 'di dag rkyen ces grag / ji srid mi skye de srid du ;
analyzed: de phyir 'di dag rkyen ces grag / ji srid mi skye de srid du ;
translated: As long as they do not arise,ğŸ”½How can they be conditions?

original: /'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
analyzed: /'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
translated: Conditions are not tenable

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //ğŸ”½rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //ğŸ”½med na gang gi rkyen ces bya //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang // rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te // med na gang gi rkyen ces bya //
translated: For either an existent or a nonexistent thing.ğŸ”½If something is nonexistent, what could be its conditions?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what use are conditions?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa bzhi po de dag gis rgyu'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen bzhi po bsdus pa thams cad spyir dgag pa bstan pas na de'i phyir de ltar re zhig rkyen rnams spyir dgag pa bstan nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa bzhi po de dag gis rgyu'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen bzhi po bsdus pa thams cad spyir dgag pa bstan pas na de'i phyir de ltar re zhig rkyen rnams spyir dgag pa bstan nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In these four verses, he has taught the refutation of all the four conditions in general, the causal condition, the objective condition, the immediate condition, and the dominant condition. Therefore, he says, â€œThus, having taught the refutation of the conditions in general. â€

original: da ni de dag khyad par du dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pas 'di bshad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ni de dag khyad par du dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pas 'di bshad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, wishing to refute them in particular, he explains:

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rkyen bzhi po de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rkyen bzhi po de dag go //
translated: â€œThemâ€ refers to the four conditions.

original: khyad par du dgag pa'i zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhi po de dag re re nas khyad par du dgag pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du dgag pa'i zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhi po de dag re re nas khyad par du dgag pa'o //
translated: â€œIn particularâ€ means that each of the four conditions is refuted.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: â€œAspectâ€ means a different aspect.

original: 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de bya bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de bya bar 'dod pas so //
translated: â€œWishingâ€ means wishing to make that aspect.

original: 'di bshad do zhes bya ba ni de dag khyad par du dgag pa 'dod pa des rkyen bzhi po de dag re re nas khyad par du dgag pa'i rnam pa 'og nas @190a * //
analyzed: 'di bshad do zhes bya ba ni de dag khyad par du dgag pa 'dod pa des rkyen bzhi po de dag re re nas khyad par du dgag pa'i rnam pa 'og nas @190a * //
translated: The phrase â€œthis will be explainedâ€ indicates that the author wishes to refute each of the four conditions individually.

original: 'byung ba'i gzhung de dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gzhung de dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: The following passages will explain the refutation.ğŸ”½With regard to the causal condition, the text states, â€œFirst, the causal condition is refuted.â€

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyu'i rkyen dang po yin la /ğŸ”½gzhan dag phyi ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyu'i rkyen dang po yin la / gzhan dag phyi ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The causal condition is the first of the four conditions.

original: dang por de nyid dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: dang por de nyid dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: Therefore, the author begins his refutation with the causal condition.

original: 'di la rkyen rnams spyi yin yang bskyed par bya ba skyed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de rkyen du 'dod do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di la rkyen rnams spyi yin yang bskyed par bya ba skyed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de rkyen du 'dod do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The text states, â€œAlthough the conditions are general, only that which produces the effect is considered to be the condition.â€

original: 'di ltar sa bon dang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa rkyen rnams myu gu skyed pa'i rkyen spyi yin par gzhan dag sems mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon dang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa rkyen rnams myu gu skyed pa'i rkyen spyi yin par gzhan dag sems mod kyi /
translated: This passage is explained as follows. Although the conditions such as the seed, the earth, water, fire, wind, and so on, are general conditions for the production of the sprout, others believe that only that which produces the effect is the condition.

original: 'on kyang sa bon kho na las myu gu skye'i sa bon la sogs pa las mi skye bas de'i phyir bskyed par bya ba myu gu skyed pa'i rkyen sa bon gang yin pa de rgyu'i rkyen yin par bstan bcos mdzad pa bzhed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon kho na las myu gu skye'i sa bon la sogs pa las mi skye bas de'i phyir bskyed par bya ba myu gu skyed pa'i rkyen sa bon gang yin pa de rgyu'i rkyen yin par bstan bcos mdzad pa bzhed do //
translated: However, since a sprout is produced only from a seed and not from a seed and so on, the seed that is the condition producing the sprout to be produced is asserted by the treatise author to be the causal condition.

original: 'o na bskyed par bya ba skye ba ni tshogs pa la rag las pa'i phyir bskyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'o na bskyed par bya ba skye ba ni tshogs pa la rag las pa'i phyir bskyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhan dag na re /
translated: If you say that since the production of what is to be produced depends on the assemblage, production is not singular,

original: 'o na bskyed par bya ba myu gu ni sa bon dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba rgyu rkyen tshos pa spyi la rag las pa'i phyir myu gu skyed pa ni sa bon gcig pu ma yin pas rgyu'i rkyen 'ba' zhi ga las skye ba ma
analyzed: 'o na bskyed par bya ba myu gu ni sa bon dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba rgyu rkyen tshos pa spyi la rag las pa'i phyir myu gu skyed pa ni sa bon gcig pu ma yin pas rgyu'i rkyen 'ba' zhi ga las skye ba ma
translated: here others say: If the production of the sprout to be produced depends on the assemblage of causes and conditions such as a seed, water, fire, and wind, then since a seed alone is not the producer of a sprout, how could a sprout arise from a causal condition that is singular?

original: yin no zhes rgyu'i rkyen nyid 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes rgyu'i rkyen nyid 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: This refutes the assertion that the seed alone is the causal condition.

original: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba 'di ni 'grel ba byed pas sngar gzhan dag na re bskyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhes bya bas rgyu'i rkyen 'gog par byed pa de khas blangs pa yin te
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba 'di ni 'grel ba byed pas sngar gzhan dag na re bskyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhes bya bas rgyu'i rkyen 'gog par byed pa de khas blangs pa yin te
translated: Although it is true that it is untenable to have a single cause, since arising is refuted, this is what the commentator previously said, â€œGeneration is not a single thing,â€ and he accepted the refutation of the causal condition.ğŸ”½Since arising from all conditions is refuted ultimately, since a sprout does not arise from a single seed, generation is not a single thing.

original: / don dam par rkyen thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir sa bon gcig pu las kyang myu gu mi skye bas skyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhes bya bas rgyu'i rkyen de mi 'thad pa ni 'dod do zhes zur gyis khas blangs pa yin
analyzed: / don dam par rkyen thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir sa bon gcig pu las kyang myu gu mi skye bas skyed pa nyid ni gcig pu ma yin no zhes bya bas rgyu'i rkyen de mi 'thad pa ni 'dod do zhes zur gyis khas blangs pa yin
translated: This is what he implicitly accepted, since he accepted that the causal condition is untenable.

original: no // 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: no // 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //ğŸ”½dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,ğŸ”½no entity whatsoever

original: skyed pa nam yang yod ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: skyed pa nam yang yod ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs pas /
translated: is ever generated anywhere.

original: don dam par rkyen thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir rgyu nyid med pas skyed pa nyid med pa ni bden no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par rkyen thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir rgyu nyid med pas skyed pa nyid med pa ni bden no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because ultimately arising from all conditions is refuted, it is true that there is no cause and hence no arising.ğŸ”½However, we will explain how the ultimate cause is untenable, having accepted the presentation of conventional causes.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas don dam pa'i rgyu'i nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa ni 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas don dam pa'i rgyu'i nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa ni 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although we agree that it is untenable because ultimately arising is refuted,

original: 'on kyang gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dag na re /
translated: however, others say,

original: @190b dbu ma pa 'di dag la ni skye ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa tsam zhig yod du zad kyi /ğŸ”½rna pa gzhi ni ci yang med do zhes zer na mi rung bas de'i phyir tha snyad kyi rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas /
analyzed: @190b dbu ma pa 'di dag la ni skye ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa tsam zhig yod du zad kyi / rna pa gzhi ni ci yang med do zhes zer na mi rung bas de'i phyir tha snyad kyi rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas /
translated: â€œThese MÄdhyamikas have only a form of refutation that refutes arising.ğŸ”½They have no basis at all.

original: don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad par de ltar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad par de ltar bshad par bya ste /
translated: â€ Since that is unacceptable, we will explain how the ultimate cause is untenable, having accepted the presentation of conventional causes.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu yang rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa med du zin na ni des na dan dam par de dgag tu yang med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu yang rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa med du zin na ni des na dan dam par de dgag tu yang med par 'gyur bas /
translated: If the causal condition were not posited even conventionally, then it would not be negated even conventionally.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob pa'i rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob pa'i rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas so //
translated: Therefore, having accepted the positing of the causal condition conventionally,

original: don dam pa'i yul la rgyu'i rkyen de nyid du ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i yul la rgyu'i rkyen de nyid du ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: it should be explained that the causal condition is not tenable in reality.

original: de la tha snyad pa'i zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: de la tha snyad pa'i zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: In this regard, â€œconventionalâ€ means â€œconcealer. â€

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: â€œCauseâ€ means â€œcausal condition. â€

original: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: â€œPositingâ€ means â€œdetermining. â€

original: khas blangs nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas so //
analyzed: khas blangs nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas so //
translated: â€œHaving acceptedâ€ means â€œhaving accepted as a cause. â€

original: don dam pa'i zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i yul gyi'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i yul gyi'o //
translated: â€œRealityâ€ means â€œthe object of reality. â€

original: rgyu'i rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: â€œCausal conditionâ€ means â€œthe cause of the designation of the term causal condition. â€

original: ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par gyu'i rkyen ni ji ltar mi 'thad pas de las dngos po rnams skye ba med pa de ltar sgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par gyu'i rkyen ni ji ltar mi 'thad pas de las dngos po rnams skye ba med pa de ltar sgrub par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning: we will prove how it is untenable that conditions exist ultimately, and how therefore things do not arise from them.

original: 'di la rgyu ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa 'di la sa bon gyi mtshan nyid rgyu'i rkyen ces bya bar khas blangs pa ni 'di lta bu yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa 'di la sa bon gyi mtshan nyid rgyu'i rkyen ces bya bar khas blangs pa ni 'di lta bu yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the reason: in this context, the presentation of the conventional reason is as follows: the seed, which has the characteristic of a cause, is accepted as the causal condition.

original: yod pa'am med pa'am yod med cing bsgrub pa yin par 'dod grang na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa'am yod med cing bsgrub pa yin par 'dod grang na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you assert that it is established as existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni myu gu yod pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni myu gu yod pa'o //
translated: â€œexistentâ€ refers to the existence of the sprout.

original: med pa zhes bya ba yang myu gu med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba yang myu gu med pa'o //
translated: â€œNonexistentâ€ refers to the nonexistence of the sprout.

original: yod med ces bya ba yang myu gu yod med gnyi ga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yod med ces bya ba yang myu gu yod med gnyi ga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: â€œBoth existent and nonexistentâ€ refers to the nature of both the existence and nonexistence of the sprout.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'o //
translated: â€œEstablishedâ€ means produced.

original: yin par 'dod grang na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: yin par 'dod grang na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: If you accept, then you accept it conventionally.ğŸ”½And also, etc. shows how ultimate causal efficacy is untenable.

original: de yang zhes bya ba sogs pas ni don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba sogs pas ni don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan to //
translated: When a phenomenon is not established as existent,

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: de yi tshe na don dam par //
analyzed: de yi tshe na don dam par //
translated: at that time,ğŸ”½how could it be called an ultimate

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //ğŸ”½de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na ste zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin te de dam par 'bras bu myu gu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yod pa dang med pa dang yod med gnyi ga mi bsgrub pa de'i tshe na rgyu'i rkyen de 'bras bu
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya // de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na ste zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin te de dam par 'bras bu myu gu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yod pa dang med pa dang yod med gnyi ga mi bsgrub pa de'i tshe na rgyu'i rkyen de 'bras bu
translated: causal process?ğŸ”½It is not a causal process at all is the position. When a phenomenon characterized by an effect such as a sprout is not established as existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent, at that time, that causal condition is not a causal process at all.

original: sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na yin pas rgyu ma yin no zhes dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na yin pas rgyu ma yin no zhes dgag pa yin no //
translated: It is not a cause at all.

original: yod pa'i phyir dang med pa'i phyir bdag dang @191a * //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dang med pa'i phyir bdag dang @191a * //
translated: Because it exists and does not exist,

original: gzhan bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyi ga'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos yin no //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The argument is as follows:

original: rkyen ni 'bras bu'i chos yod par skyed par byed pa ma yin te yod pa'i phyir dper na bdag bzhin te /
analyzed: rkyen ni 'bras bu'i chos yod par skyed par byed pa ma yin te yod pa'i phyir dper na bdag bzhin te /
translated: A condition does not cause the generation of an existent effect, because it exists, like the self.

original: ji ltar rgyus rgyu bdag nyid skyed par mi byed par rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyus rgyu bdag nyid skyed par mi byed par rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be undermined by the inference that a cause does not generate itself.

original: 'bras bu'i chos med par skyed par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos med par skyed par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it cause the generation of a nonexistent effect.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na gzhan bzhin te /
translated: Because it does not exist, like another.

original: ji ltar rgyu sa bon gyi sa bum pa la sogs pa gzhan skyed par mi byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu sa bon gyi sa bum pa la sogs pa gzhan skyed par mi byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be undermined by the inference that a cause such as a seed does not generate another such as a pot.

original: 'bras bu'i chos yod med gnyis ka yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos yod med gnyis ka yang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it cause the generation of an effect that is both existent and nonexistent.

original: phyogs gnyis ka'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag dang gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag dang gzhan bzhin te /
translated: Because it would have the faults of both, like self and other.

original: ji ltar rgyus bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga skyed par byed pa ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs so //ğŸ”½de ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par rgyu'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyus bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga skyed par byed pa ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs so // de ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par rgyu'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The Master thinks that it would be undermined by inference, just as a cause does not produce both self and other.ğŸ”½Thus, because the cause of a cause is untenable, that also is untenable.

original: 'bras bu skye ba de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning: because the cause of the designation of the condition of a cause is untenable, the arising of an effect is also untenable.

original: re zhig de nyid tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de nyid tha snyad pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa khas blangs nas don dam pa'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having accepted the presentation of a cause of a cause as a conventional cause, it is explained how the cause of a cause is untenable in an ultimate sense.

original: da ni bskyed par bya ba 'bras bu dang skyed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de gnyis ka tha snyad pa yin par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bskyed par bya ba 'bras bu dang skyed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de gnyis ka tha snyad pa yin par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, it should be established that both the effect that is generated and the condition that generates it are conventional.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni bskyed par bya ba mngon par bsgrubs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni bskyed par bya ba mngon par bsgrubs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œThe cause of a cause is taught by the establishment of what is generated.â€

original: rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The cause of a cause is the cause of the designation of the condition of a cause.

original: bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de ste /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de ste /
translated: What is generated is the effect.

original: rgyu las skye zhing rgyus bskyed par bya ba dang 'byung bar bya ba yin pas bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu las skye zhing rgyus bskyed par bya ba dang 'byung bar bya ba yin pas bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: It is generated from a cause and is generated and produced by a cause, and therefore it is what is generated.

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid myu gu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid myu gu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The sprout is the characteristic of an effect.

original: mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba de mngon par bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba de mngon par bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The establishment of what is generated is the establishment of that which is generated.

original: 'bras bu bskyed pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is generated by the effect.

original: bstan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa ste bstan pa dang rjes su dpag pa dang bsgrub par bya ba yin na'o //
analyzed: bstan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa ste bstan pa dang rjes su dpag pa dang bsgrub par bya ba yin na'o //
translated: If it is an object of expression, then it is to be generated, to be accomplished, and it is to be expressed, inferred, and established.

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid @191b kyis mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu can rgyu las skye ba ni tha snyad pa yin la zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid @191b kyis mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir rgyu can rgyu las skye ba ni tha snyad pa yin la zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Since it does not generate or accomplish an entity that has the nature of existence, etc., the conventional designation of cause and effect is tenable.

original: gal te 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa'am yod med gnyi ga'i bdag nyid cig skyed cing mngon par sgrub par byed na ni des na sa bon la rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags su yang rung ba zhig na de la yang gang gi phyir don dam par yod pa
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa'am yod med gnyi ga'i bdag nyid cig skyed cing mngon par sgrub par byed na ni des na sa bon la rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags su yang rung ba zhig na de la yang gang gi phyir don dam par yod pa
translated: This is what is being said: If an effect were generated or accomplished as existent, nonexistent, or as having the nature of both existence and nonexistence, then it would be tenable to designate the seed as the cause.ğŸ”½But in that regard, since ultimately the seed does not exist,

original: dang yod med gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis skyed cing mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa de'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu can rgyu las skye ba ni tha snyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dang yod med gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis skyed cing mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa de'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu can rgyu las skye ba ni tha snyad pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not produced and established by an existent, nonexistent, or existent and nonexistent self-nature, therefore the conventional is the production of a result with a cause from a cause.

original: de la yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi sa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i chos yod pa dang med pa dang yod med gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ji skad sngar bstan pas so //
analyzed: de la yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi sa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i chos yod pa dang med pa dang yod med gnyis ka'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ji skad sngar bstan pas so //
translated: Therein, â€œby an existent, etc., self-natureâ€ means by an existent, nonexistent, or existent and nonexistent self-nature of a result-entity, as previously explained.

original: mngon par sgrub pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyus bskyed cing mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyus bskyed cing mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œBecause it does not establishâ€ means because it is not produced and established by a cause.

original: rgyu can zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rgyu can zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: â€œWith a causeâ€ means a result.

translated: â€œMadhyamaka treatiseâ€ means the philosophy of the Madhyamikas.ğŸ”½â€œNot a text that posits a positionâ€ means that it is not a text that posits a position in the sense of a position that is to be established.

analyzed: gang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' sun 'byin pa tsam 'ba' zhig byed cing rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la cung zad kyang sgrub par mi byed pas 'di ltar gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dngos po 'gog pa tsam 'ba' zhig byed pa de ni gzhung mi gzugs pa

translated: Not from both, nor without a cause.ğŸ”½In no place and in no way

analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung gi tshogs kyis bkag pas de'i phyir brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa ni med do //
translated: Since this and other such collections of scriptures refute arising, therefore there is no attachment to expressions.

analyzed: brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa zhes bya ba ni de bstsal pa'o //
translated: â€œRefutation of attachment to expressionsâ€ is the refutation of that.

analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la mngon @194b par zhen pa dgag pa'i rnam pa de bya bar 'dod pas so //
translated: â€œWishesâ€ means wishing to perform that aspect of the refutation of attachment to expressions.

analyzed: dbu ma pa dag brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i rnam pa 'dod pa des slob dpon gyis /
translated: says this:ğŸ”½When a phenomenon is not established as existent,

analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //

analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //

translated: This is illogical.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis ni brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis ni brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pa bstan to //
translated: This verse teaches the refutation of clinging to expressions.ğŸ”½Here the condensed meaning is this:

analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse is this.ğŸ”½If it is asserted to be a cause because it establishes,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rgyur 'dod na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir sa bon la rgyu zhes brjod par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: if it is asserted to be a cause because it generates an effect, then it should be called a cause in the sense of a seed. This is the meaning of the phrase â€œif it is asserted to be a cause because it establishes.â€

original: de yang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la yang mi srid pas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la yang mi srid pas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Moreover, since it is impossible for an existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent effect, it is said:

analyzed: 'bras bu gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la yang rgyus bya ba med de gnyi ga'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, an effect that is both existent and nonexistent is not produced by a cause, because it would be the condition of both.

analyzed: des na rgyur brjod pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu med pa'i phyir /

analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi rigs pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that the cause of a cause is illogical.

original: rgyur brjod pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu ste 'bras bu skyes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur brjod pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags pa la 'jug pa'i byed rgyu ste 'bras bu skyes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause for engaging in the expression â€œcauseâ€ is the cause for engaging in the expression â€œcauseâ€ because it is the cause for engaging in the expression â€œcause.â€ That is, it is the cause for engaging in the expression â€œcauseâ€ because it is the cause for engaging in the expression â€œcause.â€

original: de med pa'i phyir rgyu zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir rgyu nyid gzhan dag gis yod par brtags par mi rigs pas sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rgyur 'dod pa de mi grub po //

translated: Because that does not exist, it is illogical for others to imagine that a cause exists in order to designate it as a cause. Therefore, since the cause is not established, the assertion that it is a cause in order to establish that is not established.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la yang zhes bya ba chos can la /
