original: dmigs pa med de zhes bya ba'i chos khyad par can sgrub pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med de zhes bya ba'i chos khyad par can sgrub pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is the existence of the special property to be proven, â€œit is not an object.â€

original: dmigs pa med de zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med de zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: That it is not an object is the property to be proven.

original: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la yang zhes bya ba chos can de la don dam par dmigs pa med de zhes bya ba chos khyad par can de bsgrub par bya ba yin @196b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la yang zhes bya ba chos can de la don dam par dmigs pa med de zhes bya ba chos khyad par can de bsgrub par bya ba yin @196b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With respect to the subject, consciousness that is now arising, there is the existence of the special property to be proven, â€œultimately it is not an object.â€

original: skye bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: Because it is now arising is the property that proves that.

original: gang dang gang skye bzhin pa de dang de la dmigs pa med do zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang skye bzhin pa de dang de la dmigs pa med do zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be established that that which is in the process of arising is not the objective support of that consciousness.

original: gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase â€œlike formâ€ is to be supplied.

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa skye bzhin pa'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa skye bzhin pa'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because a pot, cloth, etc. are in the process of arising, they are not the objective support of that consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la yang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa med do //
translated: In the same way, form, etc. are not the objective support of consciousness in the process of arising.

original: gang gi dmigs pa'i rkyen gzugs dang chos thams cad kyi bar dag yin par mdo sde'i mtha' las rnam par gzhag pa de'i dgag pa yang de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi dmigs pa'i rkyen gzugs dang chos thams cad kyi bar dag yin par mdo sde'i mtha' las rnam par gzhag pa de'i dgag pa yang de ltar bya'o //
translated: The refutation of that consciousness whose objective condition is form, etc. should be understood in the same way as it is presented in the Prakaraá¹‡a.

original: ci'i phyir dgag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgag par bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it to be refuted?

original: rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa yin pa'i byed rgyu ni dmigs pa nyid yin pas dmigs par byed pa bkag na dmigs pa yang bkag pa kho nar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa yin pa'i byed rgyu ni dmigs pa nyid yin pas dmigs par byed pa bkag na dmigs pa yang bkag pa kho nar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because the cause of the activity of consciousness as the agent of perception is the objective support itself. Thus, when the agent of perception is refuted, the objective support is also refuted.

original: de lta yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa med pa kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par nye bar bstan cing bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de lta yin pa'i chos 'di dmigs pa med pa kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par nye bar bstan cing bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord has taught and said that this phenomenon, which is thus, is only devoid of an objective referent in the ultimate.

original: 'o na chos mngon pa la dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag tu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos mngon pa la dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag tu zhe na /
translated: But in the Abhidharma, are they not said to have objective referents?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
translated: Have they not said that the six collections of consciousness have objective referents?

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: it is said that â€œhaving objective referentsâ€ is posited in terms of the system of conventional truth.

original: chos mngon pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag dmigs pa dang bcas par gsungs pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag dmigs pa dang bcas par gsungs pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that in the Abhidharma, the six collections of consciousness are said to have objective referents.

original: de ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs nges par rnam par gzhag cing yongs su bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs nges par rnam par gzhag cing yongs su bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: That is said and taught in order to posit and present the system of conventional truth.

original: don dam par dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that they have objective referents in the ultimate.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa gang gis skye ba ni der snang ba skye ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'i nor can bzhin du dus gcig kho nar 'brel pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa gang gis skye ba ni der snang ba skye ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'i nor can bzhin du dus gcig kho nar 'brel pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore he says, â€œThat which arises due to an object is said to possess an object because consciousness appears as that object. It is not said that they are related only at one time, like a debtor and his debt.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½dmigs pa ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa gang gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na gang gi phyir yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dag la rnam par shes pa de yang de'i rnam pa sngon po dang @197a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dmigs pa ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa gang gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na gang gi phyir yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dag la rnam par shes pa de yang de'i rnam pa sngon po dang @197a * //
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ser po la sogs par snang ba skye ba de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: ser po la sogs par snang ba skye ba de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'i /
translated: When consciousness arises in the aspect of an object, such as blue or yellow, it is said to possess an object because consciousness that is blue or yellow and so on appears as that object, such as blue or yellow.

original: ji ltar lha sbyin nor dang ldan pa bzhin du nor dang nor can gnyi ga dus gcig kho nar 'brel pa lta bu'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lha sbyin nor dang ldan pa bzhin du nor dang nor can gnyi ga dus gcig kho nar 'brel pa lta bu'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as Devadatta is related to his wealth, both the possessor and the possession are related at the same time.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yang dag pa ma yin pa las sgro btags pa yin te dus gcig na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yang dag pa ma yin pa las sgro btags pa yin te dus gcig na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the so-called possession of an object is a superimposition on what is not real even conventionally, because it does not exist at the same time.

original: de'i lan ni 'ga' zhig gis de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i lan ni 'ga' zhig gis de'i phyir /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
analyzed: de ltar chos ni dmigs med na //
translated: Thus, the dharma is not an object.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par dmigs par byed pa rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par dmigs par byed pa rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that ultimately there is no apprehending subject because ultimately there is no consciousness that apprehends an object.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa ma skyes na de la dmigs par byed pa nyid dgag par mi rigs so zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa ma skyes na de la dmigs par byed pa nyid dgag par mi rigs so zhes zer na /
translated: If consciousness does not arise, it is not tenable to refute the existence of an apprehending subject.

original: de'i lan ni 'ga' zhig gis dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa nyid yongs su brtags pa gang mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni 'ga' zhig gis dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa nyid yongs su brtags pa gang mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The answer to that is: because it is untenable that some would impute an object that is not an object of observation.

original: skye bar smra ba 'ga' zhig gis rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa nyid yod par yongs su brtags pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye bar smra ba 'ga' zhig gis rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa nyid yod par yongs su brtags pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is untenable that some who advocate arising would impute the existence of form and so on as objects of observation that are not objects of observation of consciousness.

original: log par brtags pa de 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: log par brtags pa de 'gog par byed do //
translated: This refutes that false imputation.

original: de ltar de dmigs pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de dmigs pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it is untenable that it is an object of observation,

original: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could an object of observation exist?

original: 'di la gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don te /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of this is that form and so on are only not objects of observation.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that meaning,

original: dper na mtshams med pa byed pa la mngon par rtogs pa yod pa ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes khungs bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na mtshams med pa byed pa la mngon par rtogs pa yod pa ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes khungs bstan pa yin te /
translated: For example, how could one who commits heinous acts have manifest realization?

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What does this passage teach?

original: mtshams med pa byed pa la bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa la bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: How could one who commits heinous acts have manifest realization of the truths?

original: 'dir yang dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang dmigs pa yod par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It teaches that just as that is impossible, so too it is impossible to have an object here.ğŸ”½Even so, the meaning of that reason is unestablished and contradictory.

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par rkyen bstan pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod na ni de gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i don
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs de nyid kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par rkyen bstan pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod na ni de gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i don
translated: If you assert that the reason is â€œbecause conditions are taught,â€ then it is unestablished and contradictory with respect to any object.

original: de nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid do //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: 'on te gnyi ga la grub par bya ba'i phyir @197b kun rdzob tu rkyen bstan pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod na ni des na kun rdzob tu rkyen bstan pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yod pas 'dir yang khyod ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pas khyod nyid ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga la grub par bya ba'i phyir @197b kun rdzob tu rkyen bstan pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod na ni des na kun rdzob tu rkyen bstan pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yod pas 'dir yang khyod ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pas khyod nyid ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid do //
translated: But if you assert that the reason is stated in order to prove both, because conditions are taught conventionally, then the teaching of conditions conventionally has a relationship of invariable concomitance with ultimate realitylessness, and so this also contradicts your assertion of inherent existence.

original: gzhan dag la yang rnam par brtags pa mtshungs par ltag chod sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa gzhan dag dbu ma pas sngar skye bzhin pa la yang dmigs pa med de skye bzhin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rnam par brtags pa mtshungs par ltag chod sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa gzhan dag dbu ma pas sngar skye bzhin pa la yang dmigs pa med de skye bzhin pa'i phyir /
translated: Others apply the same reductio to the Abhidharma masters.

original: gzugs bzhin no zhes sgrub pa bstan pa gang yin pa de la mi rigs par brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so zhes rigs pa can gyi sgyu thabs kyis ltag chod sbyor bar byed pa yin na //
analyzed: gzugs bzhin no zhes sgrub pa bstan pa gang yin pa de la mi rigs par brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so zhes rigs pa can gyi sgyu thabs kyis ltag chod sbyor bar byed pa yin na //
translated: The LokÄyataâ€™s sophistic rejoinder is that the same kind of irrationality and analysis applies to the example of form.

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Form is not an object of observationğŸ”½because it is included in the form aggregate.

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bas rigs ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na / gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bas rigs ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge says, â€œWhat are phenomena that are not objects of observation?ğŸ”½Form and nirvÄá¹‡a.â€

original: chos mngon pa pa dag gis dbu ma pa'i dpe gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba der rung bar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /ğŸ”½dbu ma pa khyed na re /ğŸ”½gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa dag gis dbu ma pa'i dpe gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba der rung bar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te / dbu ma pa khyed na re / gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The word â€œindeedâ€ in the line â€œIndeed, form is not an object of observationâ€ is a statement that proves that the example of form is suitable.

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba gang yin pa de ni rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba gang yin pa de ni rigs so //
translated: The LokÄyata say, â€œThe statement â€˜Form is not an object of observation because it is included in the form aggregateâ€™ is correct.

original: ci'i phyir rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs she na /
translated: Why is it correct?

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Also, the treatise on Abhidharma states:

original: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that lack an object?ğŸ”½Form and nirvana.

original: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gzugs la dmigs pa nyid med do zhes bya ba de ni bden no //
analyzed: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gzugs la dmigs pa nyid med do zhes bya ba de ni bden no //
translated: Therefore, it is true that they do not focus on form.ğŸ”½But it is not correct to accept that the mind and mental factors do not have an object, because the Abhidharma states:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa gang yin pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa gang yin pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the phenomena that have an object?ğŸ”½They are the mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so zhes byung ba de khas len pas mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa dag gis dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba değŸ”½mi rung bar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so zhes byung ba de khas len pas mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa dag gis dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba de mi rung bar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement by the Abhidharma masters that it is incorrect to prove that the mind and mental factors do not have an object.

original: dbu ma pa khyed sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas @198a * //
analyzed: dbu ma pa khyed sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas @198a * //
translated: This is a statement that it is incorrect to prove that the mind and mental factors do not have an object.

original: len pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: len pa gang yin pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not logical to accept that.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not logical?

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: In the Abhidharma treatise,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: it is said, â€œWhat are the phenomena that have an object?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so zhes 'byung la /
translated: mind and mental factors.â€

original: khyed kyang sangs rgyas pa yin pas khyed kyis kyang lung de snga nas khas blangs pas de'i phyir 'dis dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa la gnod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: khyed kyang sangs rgyas pa yin pas khyed kyis kyang lung de snga nas khas blangs pas de'i phyir 'dis dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len pa la gnod par 'gyur bas /
translated: And since you are Buddhists, you have previously accepted that scripture. Therefore, since this contradicts the acceptance that there is no object,

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du sgrub pa de ni mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du sgrub pa de ni mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: it is not logical to prove that mind and mental factors have no object.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: That is not logical.

original: dpe sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dpe sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because the example is not established.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: khyod kyi gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyi gzugs ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Your form does not have an object.

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are phenomena that do not have an object?

original: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bas rigs na zhes bya ba'i lung smras pa gang yin pa des kho bos skye bzhin pa la yang dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung bas rigs na zhes bya ba'i lung smras pa gang yin pa des kho bos skye bzhin pa la yang dmigs pa med de /
translated: They are form and nirvana.

original: skye bzhin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no zhes bya bas rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de'i dpe gzugs las blangs pa de la bsgrub pa'i phyir kho bo dpe grub pas khyod kyi sgrub pa
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no zhes bya bas rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa la dmigs pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de'i dpe gzugs las blangs pa de la bsgrub pa'i phyir kho bo dpe grub pas khyod kyi sgrub pa
translated: The example of form that you cite in the proof that consciousness that is arising does not have an object because it is arising, like form, is established for us.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore your proof is not logical.

original: ci ste 'di skad ces 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs nyid ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa med pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste 'di skad ces 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs nyid ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa med pa bden mod kyi /
translated: If you say: It is true that form derived from the elements is form and it does not have an object.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa ni skye bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa ni skye bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa yod de /
translated: That which is not derived from the elements, the consciousness that is arising, exists as the object of that which is arising, because it is arising.ğŸ”½For example, the mind and mental factors that are not derived from the elements exist as objects apprehended by that which apprehends them, because they are arising.

original: dper na 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams skye bzhin pa'i phyir de dag gzung ba'i yul 'dzin par byed pa de bzhin du 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pas shes pa yang skye bzhin pa'i phyir de gzung
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams skye bzhin pa'i phyir de dag gzung ba'i yul 'dzin par byed pa de bzhin du 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pas shes pa yang skye bzhin pa'i phyir de gzung
translated: In the same way, consciousness that is not derived from the elements exists as the object of that which apprehends it, because it is arising.

original: ba'i yul 'dzin par gyur pa de la dmigs pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa nyid gtan @198b tshigs su brjod na yang dpe med pa'iğŸ”½phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ba'i yul 'dzin par gyur pa de la dmigs pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa nyid gtan @198b tshigs su brjod na yang dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The author of the commentary here responds to the opponentâ€™s position that was stated earlier, â€œThat which is not derived from the elements is the reason, but there is no example.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid dmigs pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs su brjod na yang khyed la dpe med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin pa rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid dmigs pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs su brjod na yang khyed la dpe med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you assert that consciousness that is not derived from the elements arises in dependence on an object, that is illogical because you have no example.

original: ji ltar sems kyi dmigs pa nyid 'gog par byed pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa yang 'gog par 'gyur bas de'i phyir sems la dmigs pa yod pa'i dpe sems las byung ba rnams la khas blangs pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi dmigs pa nyid 'gog par byed pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa yang 'gog par 'gyur bas de'i phyir sems la dmigs pa yod pa'i dpe sems las byung ba rnams la khas blangs pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as you refute the object of consciousness, you also refute the object of mental factors. Therefore, since you do not accept the example of consciousness having an object, that is, mental factors, your assertion is illogical.

original: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len na lung las dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la dmigs pa med pa nyid du khas len na lung las dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: If you accept that consciousness and mental factors do not have objects, then how do you interpret the scriptural statement, â€œWhat are phenomena that possess an object?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams so zhes 'byung ba de khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur bas mi rigs so zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba ;
analyzed: sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams so zhes 'byung ba de khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur bas mi rigs so zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba ;
translated: It is illogical to say that the object of observation is the object of the mind and mental factors because that contradicts the assertion that the object of observation is the object of observation of minds and mental factors.ğŸ”½In response to that, the author of the commentary says, â€œIf they imagine the meaning of those passages to be that the object of observation is the object apprehended by minds and mental factors, then the object apprehended by minds and mental factors would be refuted.â€ğŸ”½If they imagine the meaning of those passages to be that the object of observation is the object apprehended by minds and mental factors, then the object apprehended by minds and mental factors would be refuted.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gal te gzung ba ni dmigs pa'o zhes de dag gi don la rtog na yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung ba nyid 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /ğŸ”½gal te gzung ba ni dmigs pa'o zhes de dag gi don la rtog na yang zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gal te chos mngon pa pa dag 'di skad ces lung las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las gzung ba yod par gsungs pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gi gzung ba'i don la rtog na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gal te gzung ba ni dmigs pa'o zhes de dag gi don la rtog na yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung ba nyid 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /ğŸ”½gal te gzung ba ni dmigs pa'o zhes de dag gi don la rtog na yang zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gal te chos mngon pa pa dag 'di skad ces lung las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las gzung ba yod par gsungs pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gi gzung ba'i don la rtog na yang ngo //
translated: If the Abhidharma masters imagine the meaning of those passages to be that the object of observation is the object apprehended by minds and mental factors, then the object apprehended by minds and mental factors would be refuted.

original: de ltar rtog na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rtog na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think in this way, that also is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung ba nyid 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i gzung ba nyid 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehended object of mind and mental factors will be refuted later.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul nyid kyis don dam par rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul nyid kyis don dam par rnam par shes pa dmigs par byed pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because, in accordance with the way it is taught, we do not accept that consciousness ultimately has an objective referent.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul ji skad gsungs pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul ji skad gsungs pa nyid kyis /
translated: In accordance with the way it is taught in the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa nyid yod par ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½shes rab kyi pha rol tu @199a * //
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa nyid yod par ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu @199a * //
translated: it is not said that the objective referent of mind and mental factors exists.

original: phyin pa'i tshul de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin pa'i tshul de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that way of the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyis stong lnga brgya pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyis stong lnga brgya pa las /
translated: the Lord also said in the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines:

original: gang gi tshe gzugs stong pa'am mi stong par rnam par rtog par mi byed pa de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs stong pa'am mi stong par rnam par rtog par mi byed pa de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: When one does not conceive of form as empty or not empty, then one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa /
translated: The bodhisattva SubhÅ«ti then asked the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spyod na ci la dmigs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spyod na ci la dmigs /
translated: â€œLord, when a bodhisattva practices in this way, what does he apprehend?â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied:

original: rab kyi stsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi stsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: â€œSubhÅ«ti,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spyod na gzugs la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spyod na gzugs la mi dmigs so //
translated: when a bodhisattva practices in this way, he does not apprehend form.

original: byang chub dang ldan pa'i bar la mi dmigs so zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub dang ldan pa'i bar la mi dmigs so zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: He does not apprehend up to awakening.â€

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi yul ci la yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi yul ci la yang mi dmigs so //
translated: One who practices the perfection of wisdom does not apprehend any object whatsoever, from form up to omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med de /
translated: SuvikrÄntavikrÄmin, all phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: gang la rnam par shes pa 'di dag gi dmigs par 'gyur pa'i gzung ba ni chos rnams la zung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la rnam par shes pa 'di dag gi dmigs par 'gyur pa'i gzung ba ni chos rnams la zung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in regard to phenomena, there is no apprehended object that could be the object of these consciousnesses.ğŸ”½SuvikrÄntavikrÄmin, it is like this: form is not the domain of form, up to consciousness is not the domain of consciousness.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyi spyod yul ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i bar yang rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyi spyod yul ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i bar yang rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad ni phung po lnga yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad ni phung po lnga yin la /
translated: All mundane and supramundane [phenomena] are the five aggregates.

original: de la yul can yang phung po lnga ba'i mtshan nyid yul yang phung po lnga pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yul can yang phung po lnga ba'i mtshan nyid yul yang phung po lnga pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: The object is also the defining characteristic of the five aggregates, and the subject is also the defining characteristic of the five aggregates. Therefore, since they are unborn,

original: gzugs kyang gzugs la mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gzugs kyang gzugs la mi dmigs la /
translated: form is not observed in form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang rnam par shes pa la mi dmigs pas de'i phyir chos 'ga' yang gang gi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar yang rnam par shes pa la mi dmigs pas de'i phyir chos 'ga' yang gang gi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: and consciousness is not observed in consciousness. Therefore, there is no phenomenon that is an object of experience.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: SuvikrÄntavikrÄmin, because it is not an object of experience,

original: gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: form does not know or see form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Consciousness does not know or see consciousness.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: Here it was asked of the Blessed One,

original: gang zag gzugs kyis gzugs ma 'tshal mi mthong ba dang / @199b rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang rnam par shes pa ma 'tshal mi ma thong ba de ci zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gang zag gzugs kyis gzugs ma 'tshal mi mthong ba dang / @199b rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang rnam par shes pa ma 'tshal mi ma thong ba de ci zhes bgyi /
translated: â€œWhat is it when a person does not know or see form with form, and does not know or see consciousness with consciousness?â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,ğŸ”½â€œSuvikrÄntavikrÄmin, it is when a person does not know or see form with form, and does not know or see consciousness with consciousness.â€

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams mi shes mi mthong ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams mi shes mi mthong ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Not knowing or seeing form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di la skrag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la skrag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should not be afraid of this.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang brtags zin to zhes bya ba na dmigs pa'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rkyen nyid kyang ji ltar don dam par rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa de ltar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang brtags zin to zhes bya ba na dmigs pa'i rkyen ces tha snyad gdags pa'i rkyen nyid kyang ji ltar don dam par rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa de ltar dpyad zin to //
translated: Thus, the objective condition has been examined. The very condition for the designation of an objective condition has been analyzed as to why it is not tenable as a condition in an ultimate sense.

original: da ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis skabs su bab pas de brtag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: da ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis skabs su bab pas de brtag par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Now, the immediately preceding condition is the topic at hand, so it should be examined.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang brtags zin pas de'i 'og tu de ma thag pa'i rkyen bstan pa brtag pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i phyir de dpyad cing brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen kyang brtags zin pas de'i 'og tu de ma thag pa'i rkyen bstan pa brtag pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i phyir de dpyad cing brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since the objective condition has been examined in this way, the immediately preceding condition, which is taught next, is the topic at hand, so it should be examined and analyzed. This is the meaning.

original: 'di la don dam par chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'di la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos la'o //
analyzed: 'di la don dam par chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'di la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos la'o //
translated: Here, because all things are negated in every way ultimately, here refers to the treatise of the middle way.

original: don dam par zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i yul la'o //
translated: Ultimately refers to the object of the ultimate.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi rol dang nang dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi rol dang nang dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: All things refers to all things, external and internal, mundane and transcendent.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa rnam pa thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa rnam pa thams cad las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things are negated in every way, because arising from self, other, both, and no cause is negated in every way.

original: chos rnams ma skyes so zhes de bstan zin pas zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes de rigs pas dpyad pa chen pos bstan zin pas so //
analyzed: chos rnams ma skyes so zhes de bstan zin pas zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes de rigs pas dpyad pa chen pos bstan zin pas so //
translated: Since it has been taught that all things are unarisen, since it has been taught that all things are unarisen through the great analysis of reasoning,

original: de'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes pa ma yin na 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes pa ma yin na 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: therefore, if things were not unarisen, cessation would not be tenable.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir mgo gnyis pa dgag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir mgo gnyis pa dgag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes pa yin na /
translated: Because they do not arise, like a second head.

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If phenomena do not arise, then cessation is not tenable.

original: dper na lam po cher zhugs pa'i mi'i mgo bo gnyis pa ma skyes shing med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na lam po cher zhugs pa'i mi'i mgo bo gnyis pa ma skyes shing med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because a second head of a person who has entered the road does not arise and does not exist,

original: chom rkun pa la sogs pas dgag cing gcad du med pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir dgag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chom rkun pa la sogs pas dgag cing gcad du med pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir dgag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it cannot be refuted or cut off by thieves, etc. In the same way, because mind and mental factor phenomena do not arise, they cannot be refuted.ğŸ”½What is the problem with that?

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dbu ma pa la 'dri ba ste /ğŸ”½gal te sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams la 'gag @200a * //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dbu ma pa la 'dri ba ste / gal te sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams la 'gag @200a * //
translated: This is a question to the opponent, the Follower of the Middle Way.

original: pa med na ci nyes zhes 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: pa med na ci nyes zhes 'dri ba yin no //
translated: If mind and mental factor phenomena are not ceasing, what is the problem with that?

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis /
translated: Therefore the master says:

original: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore the subsequent is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir 'gag pa med pa de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid brtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gag pa med pa de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid brtag par mi rigs so //
translated: Because there is no cessation, therefore it is not tenable to investigate the condition of immediate antecedence.

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba ni don dam par de ma thag par rkyen nyid mi rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba ni don dam par de ma thag par rkyen nyid mi rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense means that in the ultimate sense, the condition of immediate antecedence is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir de nyid don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par de ma thag pa'i dngos po rkyen nyid yin par 'dod na ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par de ma thag pa'i dngos po rkyen nyid yin par 'dod na ni don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless and self-contradictory means that if you assert that the condition of immediate antecedence exists in the ultimate sense, then it is meaningless.

original: 'on te kun rdzob tu ma thag pa'i dngos po'i rkyen nyid yin par 'dod na ni khyod don dam par de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du sgrub pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob tu ma thag pa'i dngos po'i rkyen nyid yin par 'dod na ni khyod don dam par de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du sgrub pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid yin no //
translated: But if you assert that the condition of immediate antecedence exists conventionally, then you contradict your assertion that the condition of immediate antecedence is established in the ultimate sense.

original: yang na spyir skye ba khas blangs pa na yang bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang na kho bo cag dbu ma pa don dam par skye ba khas mi len mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na spyir skye ba khas blangs pa na yang bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang na kho bo cag dbu ma pa don dam par skye ba khas mi len mod kyi /
translated: Or, if you accept arising in general, then we reply:

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du spyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams skye bar khas blangs na yang don dam par de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar bshad par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du spyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams skye bar khas blangs na yang don dam par de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar bshad par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Although in general it is accepted that mental factors and mental states arise in the world, it should be explained how it is illogical that they are the effect of the immediately preceding condition in the ultimate sense.

original: 'di la de ma thag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la de ma thag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is as follows.ğŸ”½If the cessation of the collection of mental factors and mental states is asserted to be the immediately preceding condition,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa de de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni 'di la kun rdzob tu de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'di lta bu yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa de de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni 'di la kun rdzob tu de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'di lta bu yin par 'dod do //
translated: in this regard, it is asserted that the immediately preceding condition is like this in the conventional sense.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa de ltar byung ba'i tshogs rigs mthun pa skyed par byed pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa de ltar byung ba'i tshogs rigs mthun pa skyed par byed pas de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod na'o //
translated: If the cessation of the collection of mental factors and mental states that has just occurred is asserted to be the immediately preceding condition that generates the collection of mental factors and mental states that has arisen in that way,

original: de yang tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: that is also illogical as the very condition for the arising of the collection.

original: 'gags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it has ceased, like consciousness that has ceased long ago or like form.

original: 'dir yang de yang zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang de yang zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
translated: Here, that also is the subject.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa gang yin pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa gang yin pa de yang ngo //
translated: That is, the cessation of the collection of mind and mental factors.

original: tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
analyzed: tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: It is not tenable as the condition for the arising of the collection. This is the predicate of the probandum.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs phyis skye bar 'dod pa skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs phyis skye bar 'dod pa skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: It is established that the later arising of the collection of mind and mental factors that is asserted to arise is not tenable as the condition for the arising that is about to happen.

original: 'gags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: Because it has ceased is the reason.

original: @200b sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gags pa'i phyir med pa yin pas tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du me rigs so //
analyzed: @200b sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gags pa'i phyir med pa yin pas tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du me rigs so //
translated: That is, because the cessation of the collection of mind and mental factors that has ceased does not exist, it is not tenable as the condition for the arising of the collection that is asserted to arise.

original: rnam par shas pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shas pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin te /
translated: The example is like the cessation of consciousness after a long time, or like form.ğŸ”½For example, the cessation of consciousness after a long time is not a condition for the arising of the collection, because it is interrupted by many moments of mind. And for example, the cessation of form is not an immediately preceding condition for the arising of the collection of mind and mental factors in the present.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa ni sems kyi skad cig du mas bar du chod pa'i phyir tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa dang / dper na gzugs 'gags pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs da ltar skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa gang yin pa de yang tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyidğŸ”½du mi rigs so //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa ni sems kyi skad cig du mas bar du chod pa'i phyir tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa dang / dper na gzugs 'gags pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs da ltar skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'gags pa gang yin pa de yang tshogs skye bar 'dod pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: In the same way, the cessation of the collection of mind and mental factors is not a condition for the arising of the collection.

original: de ci'i phyir 'gags pa rkyen nyid du mi rigs she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'gags pa rkyen nyid du mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it illogical for cessation to be a condition?

original: de'i phyir de la ni 'gags na rkyen kyang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ni 'gags na rkyen kyang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, â€œIf it has ceased, what would be the condition?â€

original: de ni rkyen nyid du mi srid pa kho na yin te ;
analyzed: de ni rkyen nyid du mi srid pa kho na yin te ;
translated: It is simply impossible for it to be a condition.

original: 'gags pas ni dngos po skye bar 'dod pa la phan 'dogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'gags pas ni dngos po skye bar 'dod pa la phan 'dogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /

original: gzhan dag bcas su zin kyang rkyen nyid ma yin no zhes dgag pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag bcas su zin kyang rkyen nyid ma yin no zhes dgag pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and other conditions are not conditions.

analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na /
translated: But if you think that when a thing is in the process of arising,

analyzed: 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / gal te de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du mchod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i bsam pa bstan pa ste / de la rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is assisted by the present thing that is in the process of ceasing, because it makes room for it, and that there is no error because the present thing is established as the immediately preceding condition since it is not obstructed by other past moments,ğŸ”½then this is the opponentâ€™s position.

original: rgyu so sor @201a * //
analyzed: rgyu so sor @201a * //
translated: With regard to the statement, â€œwhen a thing is in the process of arising, due to the power of the individual determination of causes and conditions,â€

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: the individual determination of causes is the so-called eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body.

original: rkyen so sor nges pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: rkyen so sor nges pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase â€œdue to the specific determination of conditionsâ€ refers to form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba ni nus pa ste rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i nus pa dbang des so ;
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba ni nus pa ste rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i nus pa dbang des so ;
translated: The phrase â€œdue to the power ofâ€ means due to the power of the specific determination of causes and conditions.

original: / dngos po skye bzhin pa na zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po skye bzhin pa na'o //
analyzed: / dngos po skye bzhin pa na zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po skye bzhin pa na'o //
translated: The phrase â€œwhen a thing is in the process of arisingâ€ refers to the arising of a thing, such as visual consciousness.

original: 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skad cig snga ma ma 'gags na ma 'ongs pa mi skye ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skad cig snga ma ma 'gags na ma 'ongs pa mi skye ba de'i phyir /
translated: The phrase â€œbecause it assists by making room for it as it is in the process of ceasingâ€ means that because the future does not arise as long as the past does not cease,

original: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: the present assists by making room for it as it is in the process of arising due to the power of the specific determination of causes and conditions.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in maintaining that the present assists the future by making room for it as it is in the process of ceasing.

original: gal te de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid 'grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'gags ma thag pa'i skad cig de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig gang
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid 'grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'gags ma thag pa'i skad cig de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig gang
translated: But if you say that there is no error because the condition as antecedent is established since it is not obstructed by moments that are different from it,

original: dag yin pa de dag gis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir des na 'gags pa spyi yin pas sems kyi skad cig bzhin du bar du ma chod pa'i sems kyi skad cig rkyen ma yin par 'gog pa de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag yin pa de dag gis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir des na 'gags pa spyi yin pas sems kyi skad cig bzhin du bar du ma chod pa'i sems kyi skad cig rkyen ma yin par 'gog pa de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not correct because the general state of having ceased is not a condition for a moment of mind that is not obstructed, like a moment of mind.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid 'grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid 'grub pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But if you say that there is no error because the condition as antecedent is established,

original: 'gags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bur rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin nam gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bur rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then it would not be undermined by inference, like consciousness that has ceased for a long time after having ceased or like form.

original: de'i lan ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnams yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnams yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is because those that are not form do not exist in a place.

original: 'di la gang dag gzugs can gzugs dang ldan pa de dag la ni go skabs 'byed par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di la gang dag gzugs can gzugs dang ldan pa de dag la ni go skabs 'byed par rigs te /
translated: It is logical that those that are form and possess form make room for each other,

original: dper na bum pa bsal ba der phru ba'i go skabs yod par 'gyur ba lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bsal ba der phru ba'i go skabs yod par 'gyur ba lta bu yin gyi /
translated: just as when a pot is removed, there is room for a saucer.

original: gang dag gzugs can ma yin pa gzugs dang mi ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba de dag la ni go skabs 'byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs can ma yin pa gzugs dang mi ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba de dag la ni go skabs 'byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: But it is illogical that those that are not form and do not possess form, such as minds and mental factors, make room for each other.

original: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa'i dbang gis dngos po skye bzhin pa na 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because things that are arising are assisted by those that are ceasing, due to the power of the individual determination of causes and conditions.

original: de ma thag pa'i @201b rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de lan du mi rung ngo //ğŸ”½gzhan yang / drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i @201b rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de lan du mi rung ngo // gzhan yang / drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: Therefore it is not correct to respond that there is no error because the state of being an immediately preceding condition is established.ğŸ”½Moreover,

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid de //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid de //
translated: the consciousness that has just ceased is the mental faculty.

original: zhes bya bas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir de lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya ba'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag 'das ma
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir de lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya ba'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag 'das ma
translated: This is because the philosophical tenet of the VaibhÄá¹£ikas is that the six types of consciousnessâ€”those called eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental consciousnessâ€”are the six collections of consciousness.

original: thag pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir 'gags ma thag pa'i yid rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thag pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir 'gags ma thag pa'i yid rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the immediately preceding consciousness is asserted to be the mental faculty, the immediately preceding mind is the condition because it is the immediately preceding condition of the mental faculty.ğŸ”½Since other past moments do not intervene, there is no fault in asserting that the immediately preceding mind is the condition.

original: de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de yang lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'das pa'i skad cig dag gis bar du ma chod pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid grub pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de yang lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: But that response is also illogical.

original: 'gags bzhin pa rkyen nyid du rtog na yang kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'gags bzhin pa rkyen nyid du rtog na yang kha cig na re /
translated: If you imagine that the mind that is in the process of ceasing is the condition, then some say:

original: dus mnyam pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo zhe'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo zhe'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is illogical that the mind that is in the process of ceasing is the immediately preceding condition because it is simultaneous.

original: gang dag 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas rkyen nyid du rtog na yang de dag la 'grel pa byed pa nyid la sogs pa dbu ma pa kha cig na re /
analyzed: gang dag 'gags bzhin pas go skabs 'byed pas rkyen nyid du rtog na yang de dag la 'grel pa byed pa nyid la sogs pa dbu ma pa kha cig na re /
translated: But if you imagine that conditions are conditions because they make a place for the arising of the effect, which is in the process of ceasing, then some Madhyamikas, such as Vimalamitra,

original: de dag gi 'gags bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'gags bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la bya ste /
translated: say that the so-called â€œprocess of ceasingâ€ is the present.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since it would follow that cause and effect would be simultaneous, that is not a suitable condition.

original: gzhan dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og ma /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed 'og ma /
translated: Others say that the second half of the verse

original: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag mi rigs //

analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa dpe med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo // 'dir gzhan dag 'di skad ces gal te don @205a * //
