original: dam par mya ngan las 'das pa med na /
analyzed: dam par mya ngan las 'das pa med na /
translated: In this regard, others say, â€œIf nirvana does not exist ultimately,ğŸ”½then how could it exist conventionally?â€

original: 'o na ji ltar zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa de yang dag par bsngags pa mdzad ces zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khang nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dus byas mi rtag pa
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa de yang dag par bsngags pa mdzad ces zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khang nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dus byas mi rtag pa
translated: In response to the opponentâ€™s question, the author of the commentary hereğŸ”½reverses our interest in conditioned phenomena, which are flawed by such

original: la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa las 'dun pa bzlog nas /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa las 'dun pa bzlog nas /
translated: faults as impermanence,

original: de la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar bstan pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar bstan pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: and in order to encourage us to aspire to nirvana, he says that nirvana is taught to be peace, but this belongs to conventional truth.

original: don dam par de yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: don dam par de yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is not that it exists ultimately.

original: 'dir 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin la /
translated: Here, â€œconditionedâ€ is the basis of the distinction.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa zhes bya ba ni de'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa zhes bya ba ni de'i khyad par yin no //
translated: The phrase defiled by the faults of impermanence, etc. indicates its particularity.

original: de la 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: Among them, the phrase conditioned refers to all things included in the defilement of action, the defilement of the passions, and the defilement of birth.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase impermanent refers to the lack of life, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sdug bsngal ba dang mi gtsang ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pas phongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i nyes pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sdug bsngal ba dang mi gtsang ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pas phongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i nyes pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes other faults of cyclic existence, such as suffering, impurity, separation from what is dear, association with what is not dear, and the frustration of not obtaining what one desires.

original: nyes pas skyon chags pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'khor ba'i nyes pas skyon chags pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pas skyon chags pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'khor ba'i nyes pas skyon chags pa'o //
translated: The phrase defiled by the faults refers to the defilement by the faults of cyclic existence, such as impermanence, etc.

original: 'dus byas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa de las 'dun pa bzlog nas zhes bya ba ni de la lhag par chags pa rnams la 'khor ba'i skyon bstan pas de las yid dbyung bar byas nas so //ğŸ”½sogs pa'i yon ta de la nya bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ches yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa de las 'dun pa bzlog nas zhes bya ba ni de la lhag par chags pa rnams la 'khor ba'i skyon bstan pas de las yid dbyung bar byas nas so // sogs pa'i yon ta de la nya bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ches yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having turned one away from that which is flawed by the faults of conditioned states, such as impermanence, etc.,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa de la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa de la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one should generate a longing for nirvana, because nirvana is endowed with the quality of being superior to samsara.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar bstan pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar bstan pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The teaching of nirvana as peace belongs to the conventional truth.

original: don dam par de yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang / zhi bar gyur pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis yang dag par bsags shing mya ngan las @205b 'das pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par de yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba dang / zhi bar gyur pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis yang dag par bsags shing mya ngan las @205b 'das pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: â€œUltimate reality is not thatâ€ means that nirvana is fully endowed with such qualities as peace, pacification, immortality, agelessness, and nondeprivation.

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa de yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa de yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nirvana is taught to exist, but that is in terms of conventional truth.

original: 'dir gzhan dag 'di skad ces gal te don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa sgyu ma lta bu ste med pa yin na //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag 'di skad ces gal te don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa sgyu ma lta bu ste med pa yin na //
translated: In this regard, others say, â€œIf nirvana is like an illusion in the ultimate, it does not exist.

original: 'o na ji tar zhi ba la sogs pa'i yod tan dag gis bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji tar zhi ba la sogs pa'i yod tan dag gis bstan par bya ste /
translated: Then how can it be taught to have the qualities of peace and so on?

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu med pa la dkar po dang sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis bstan par mi nus pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu med pa la dkar po dang sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis bstan par mi nus pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that former opponent's position, the author of the commentary here says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rtog pas sgro btags nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rtog pas sgro btags nas /
translated: The Transcendent Lord, having superimposed with conceptual thought,

original: gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la ma mos pa rnams yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bsngags par mdzad pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la ma mos pa rnams yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bsngags par mdzad pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro
translated: praised nirvana with such qualities as peace in order to truly console those beings to be trained who lack interest in the profound Dharma, because he accepted conventional truth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Thus he says and so on.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhas bya bas ni yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs bstan to //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhas bya bas ni yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs bstan to //
translated: Here, by saying the Transcendent Lord, he indicates a source of authoritative scripture.

original: rnam par rtog pas sgro btags nas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas kun nas bslad ba'i tshig tu sgro btags nas so //ğŸ”½gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la ma mos pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo gang dag chos zab mo la ma mos pa ma skyes pa dag la mos pa med pa de dag ni gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sgro btags nas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas kun nas bslad ba'i tshig tu sgro btags nas so // gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la ma mos pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i skye bo gang dag chos zab mo la ma mos pa ma skyes pa dag la mos pa med pa de dag ni gdul ba'i skye bo chos zab mo la
translated: â€œHaving superimposed with conceptualizationâ€ means having superimposed with a conventional conceptual consciousness.

original: ma mos pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma mos pa rnams so //
translated: â€œThose beings to be trained who are not devoted to the profound Dharmaâ€ means those beings to be trained who have not generated devotion to the profound Dharma. Those who do not have devotion are â€œbeings to be trained who are not devoted to the profound Dharma.â€

original: yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIn order to inspire themâ€ means in order to make them generate devotion.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / zhi bar gyur pa dang ; 'chi ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / nyams pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis so //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / zhi bar gyur pa dang ; 'chi ba med pa dang / rga ba med pa dang / nyams pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis so //
translated: â€œBy means of the qualities of peace, etc.â€ means by means of the qualities of peace, pacification, immortality, agelessness, and deathlessness, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: â€œNirvanaâ€ is the exhaustion of all afflictions and the knowledge of non-arising, which is characterized by the abandonment of all suffering.

original: yang dag par bsngags pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par son par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsngags pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par son par mdzad pa ste /
translated: â€œCorrectly praisedâ€ means â€œcorrectly attained,â€

original: 'di ltar gdul ba'i skye bo de dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa bstan pas gdul bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bsngags par mdzad pa de yang tha snyad kyi bden par @206a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gdul ba'i skye bo de dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa bstan pas gdul bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par bsngags par mdzad pa de yang tha snyad kyi bden par @206a * //
translated: because those beings to be trained are to be trained by the teaching that has reference.

original: bstan par khas blangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan par khas blangs pa yin gyi /
translated: That praise of nirvana by means of the qualities of peace, etc., is accepted as being taught in conventional truth,

original: don dam par ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not in ultimate truth.

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir dpe med pas gtan tshigs ma grub ste zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir dpe med pas gtan tshigs ma grub ste zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: de ltar don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa la yod pa nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa la yod pa nyid kyang med la /
translated: Thus, ultimately, nirvana does not exist,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: and it does not have the qualities of peace, etc.

original: des na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe med pas rkyen rnams yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub po //
analyzed: des na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe med pas rkyen rnams yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, since there is no example of nirvana, the reason that conditions exist is not established.

original: de med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams med pas khyed kyi 'dod pa'i don rkyen gzhan las skye ba mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de med pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams med pas khyed kyi 'dod pa'i don rkyen gzhan las skye ba mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œ Since that does not exist, the intended meaning is not establishedâ€ means that since conditions do not exist, the intended meaning of arising from other conditions is not established.

original: de ltar rkyen nyid bkag tu zin kyang yang gzhan dag phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po dag bsdus pa dang so so ba rkyen nyid ma yin pa dang 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid ma yin par bkag
analyzed: de ltar rkyen nyid bkag tu zin kyang yang gzhan dag phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgyu la sogs pa rkyen bzhi po dag bsdus pa dang so so ba rkyen nyid ma yin pa dang 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid ma yin par bkag
translated: Although the four conditions, such as the cause, have been refuted as conditions, either collectively or individually, and as the generators of effects,

original: tu zin kyang yang rang gi sde pa gzhan dag skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa la phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tu zin kyang yang rang gi sde pa gzhan dag skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa la phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa yin no //
translated: still, others of our own Buddhist schools still argue that arising is established and that nonarising is refuted.

original: de'i phyir de dag 'di skad ces don dam par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag 'di skad ces don dam par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, they say, â€œIn reality, the conditions that establish the internal sense bases, such as the eyes, do exist.

original: de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa bzhin no//
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa bzhin no//
translated: This is because their effects arise, just as, for example, the conditions that establish a sprout, such as a seed, exist.â€

original: gang med pa de la ni rkyen kyang med de dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang med pa de la ni rkyen kyang med de dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That which does not exist has no conditions, like the cloth of a tortoise hair.

original: 'dir yang don dam par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang don dam par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
translated: Here, the subject is â€œthe conditions that are the producers of the internal sense bases such as the eye, etc.â€

original: de la don dam par zhes bya ba ni don dam par rdzas su'o //
analyzed: de la don dam par zhes bya ba ni don dam par rdzas su'o //
translated: â€œ Ultimatelyâ€ means â€œultimately, substantially.â€

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag ces bya ba ni rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid ces bya ba nang gi skye mched gang dag gi dang por mig smos pa de ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag ces bya ba ni rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid ces bya ba nang gi skye mched gang dag gi dang por mig smos pa de ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag go //
translated: â€œ The internal sense bases such as the eye, etc.â€ are the internal sense bases such as the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind. The eye is mentioned first among them, so they are the internal sense bases such as the eye, etc.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag skyed par byed pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag skyed par byed pa'i rkyen las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / khu chu dang / khrag dang / mer med po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag skyed par byed pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag skyed par byed pa'i rkyen las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / khu chu dang / khrag dang / mer med po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase â€œthe conditions that produce themâ€ refers to the conditions that give rise to them, such as the karma, the afflictions, the semen and blood, the kalala, and so on.

original: yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
analyzed: yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œthey do existâ€ is the property that is to be proven.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen de rnams don dam par rdzas su yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin @206b no ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen de rnams don dam par rdzas su yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin @206b no ;
translated: The phrase â€œthe conditions that produce the internal sense spheres such as the eyes, etc., do exist ultimately as real substancesâ€ is the property that is to be proven.

original: / de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: / de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œbecause their effects are producedâ€ is the property that proves the thesis.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen de rnams kyi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen de rnams kyi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase â€œbecause their effects, the internal sense spheres such as the eyes, etc., are producedâ€ is the property that proves the thesis.

original: de ltar de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the reason that the effect arises,

original: rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: conditions exist.

original: dper na myu gu sgrub par rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin no //ğŸ”½dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin te /ğŸ”½dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de rnams kyi 'bras bu myu gu skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na myu gu sgrub par rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin no // dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin te / dper na myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa de rnams kyi 'bras bu myu gu skye ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, conditions exist for the production of a sprout.ğŸ”½This is a concordant example because, for example, conditions such as seeds exist for the production of a sprout because the effect of those conditions, a sprout, arises.

original: myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen de rnams kyi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag skye ba'i phyir
analyzed: myu gu sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen 'bru la sogs pa yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen de rnams kyi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag skye ba'i phyir
translated: Just as conditions such as seeds exist for the production of a sprout, so too conditions exist for the production of internal sources such as the eyes because the effect of those conditions, internal sources such as the eyes, arise.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyang yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dag sgrub par byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyang yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The conditions that establish the internal sense sources such as the eyes and so on do exist.

original: gang med pa de la ni rkyen kyang med de /
analyzed: gang med pa de la ni rkyen kyang med de /
translated: But if something does not exist, it has no conditions.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu ni med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu ni med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, since the hair of a turtle does not exist,

original: de'i 'bras bu gos 'byung ba yang med pas rus sbal gyi spu'i gos med pa de la ni de'i rkyen rus sbal gyi spu yang med pa yin gyi /ğŸ”½rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams la ni de ltar 'bras bu skye ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gos 'byung ba yang med pas rus sbal gyi spu'i gos med pa de la ni de'i rkyen rus sbal gyi spu yang med pa yin gyi / rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams la ni de ltar 'bras bu skye ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: the cloth that is its effect also does not exist. Therefore, since the hair of a turtle does not exist, the conditions for it, the hair of a turtle, also do not exist.ğŸ”½But the conditions such as the cause of a sprout do exist, because the effect, the sprout, exists.

original: de yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yod pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore conditions exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says here:

original: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: One should ask them the following: Do you say that the effect exists or does not exist in each of the conditions individually and in their collection?

original: ci khyed kyi rkyen so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la 'bras bu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ci khyed kyi rkyen so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la 'bras bu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba la /
translated: Do you say that the effect exists or does not exist in each of the conditions individually and in their collection?

original: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: What? is a word of inquiry.

original: khyed kyi zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: You refers to those who maintain that things originate.

original: rkyen so so ba dag la zhes bya ba ni rkyen re re dag la'o //
analyzed: rkyen so so ba dag la zhes bya ba ni rkyen re re dag la'o //
translated: In each of the conditions individually refers to each condition.

original: 'dus pa dag la zhes bya ba ni spyi dag la'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag la zhes bya ba ni spyi dag la'o //
translated: In their collection refers to the collection.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The effect refers to the eye, etc.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yul 'dzin nus pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yul 'dzin nus pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the nature of the effect refers to the capacity to apprehend objects such as form, etc.

original: yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba ni snga na yod pa nyid yin nam 'on te med pa nyid yin zhes dri ba'o //
analyzed: yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba ni snga na yod pa nyid yin nam 'on te med pa nyid yin zhes dri ba'o //
translated: Exists or does not exist is the inquiry as to whether it exists previously or not.

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dbu ma la 'dri ba'i @207a * //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dbu ma la 'dri ba'i @207a * //
translated: What is the point of that? is the opponent's question to the Madhyamika.

original: tshig yin te /
analyzed: tshig yin te /
translated: It is a statement.

original: gal te 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dag rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la yod na yang des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dag rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la yod na yang des cir 'gyur /
translated: If the effect, such as the eye, etc., exists in the conditions, such as the kalala, etc., individually or collectively, then what?

original: gal te med na yang des cir 'gyur zhes dri ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te med na yang des cir 'gyur zhes dri ba yin no //
translated: If it does not exist, then what?

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary himself

original: gal te yod na phyogs de'i lan ni /
analyzed: gal te yod na phyogs de'i lan ni /
translated: says, â€œIf it exists, the reply to that position is:

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what is the use of the conditions?â€

original: zhes lan btab zin to //
analyzed: zhes lan btab zin to //
translated: He has already given the reply.

original: ci ste med na de'i lan kyang //
analyzed: ci ste med na de'i lan kyang //
translated: If it does not exist, the reply to that is:

original: med na gang gi rkyen ces bya //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen ces bya //
translated: If it does not exist, what are the conditions of?

original: zhes bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½yod na dang med na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
analyzed: zhes bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te / yod na dang med na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
translated: He has already taught this.

original: // / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
translated: â€œIf it existsâ€ and â€œif it does not existâ€ are to be connected with â€œthe effect.â€

original: 'on kyang yang bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But it should be explained

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma'i mgo 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma'i mgo 'dren par byed do //
translated: This introduces the next verse.

original: de la 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khas blangs pa'i don te /
analyzed: de la 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khas blangs pa'i don te /
translated: The word â€œbutâ€ has the meaning of an assertion.

original: 'bras bu skye ba yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that even if the effect were to arise.

original: yang bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams las skye ba dgag par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //ğŸ”½gang gi tshe /ğŸ”½rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las//
analyzed: yang bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams las skye ba dgag par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro // gang gi tshe / rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las//
translated: Again, it should be explained means that the arising from conditions should be refuted.

original: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //ğŸ”½de'i tshe / rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid // de'i tshe / rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
translated: When the effect does not exist in conditions individually or collectively,

original: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni rkyen las ji ltar skye // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then how could it arise from conditions?ğŸ”½When the effect, such as visual form, does not exist in conditions individually or collectively, then how could that effect arise from conditions such as the embryonic germ disc?

original: gang gi tshe rkyen so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la 'bras bu mig la sogs pa de dag bstsal na med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa de dag ji ltar skye bar 'gyurğŸ”½te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen so so ba dang 'dus pa dag la 'bras bu mig la sogs pa de dag bstsal na med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa de dag ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It could not, because the effect does not exist in conditions individually or collectively.

original: de'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu skye ba med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu skye ba med pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, in reality, the effect does not arise at all.

original: rkyen rnams la med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams la med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the statement â€œIt does not exist in conditionsâ€ is that the effect does not exist in conditions individually or collectively.

original: don dam par 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa skye ba med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa skye ba med pa kho na ste /
translated: In reality, the effects such as eyes and so on and sprouts and so on are not produced at all.

original: rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams la 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa dag med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams la 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang myu gu la sogs pa dag med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that effects such as eyes and so on and sprouts and so on do not exist in conditions such as the oval and so on and seeds and so on.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of the verses.

original: don de gsal bar bya ba'i shes par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir rgyu spun dag las zho ji ltar 'byung ste /
analyzed: don de gsal bar bya ba'i shes par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir rgyu spun dag las zho ji ltar 'byung ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that which makes one understand that meaning, it is said, â€œHow could curd come from a pair of causes?

original: de dag la zho med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag la zho med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because curd does not exist in them.â€

original: 'ga' zhig gis rgyu spun dag las zho 'byung ngo zhes smras pa na gzhan zhig na re /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis rgyu spun dag las zho 'byung ngo zhes smras pa na gzhan zhig na re /
translated: If someone says, â€œCurd comes from a pair of causes,â€ another says,

analyzed: rgyu spun dag las zho ji ltar 'byung ste mi 'byung ngo //
translated: â€œHow could curd come from a pair of causes? It does not come from them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu spun de dag la zho med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu spun de dag la zho med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because curd does not exist in those two causes.â€

original: gang gi phyir rgyu spun dag la zho med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu spun dag la zho med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because curd does not exist in the causes, the milk and so on,ğŸ”½curd does not arise from those causes, the milk and so on.

original: rgyu spun de dag las zho mi 'byung @207b ba zhes zer ba de bzhin du 'dir yang rkyen rnams las 'bras bu mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu spun de dag las zho mi 'byung @207b ba zhes zer ba de bzhin du 'dir yang rkyen rnams las 'bras bu mi skye ste /
translated: In the same way, here, an effect does not arise from conditions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rkyen de dag las 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rkyen de dag las 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because the effect does not exist in those conditions.

original: ci ste 'bras bu la sogs pa la myu gu la sogs pa med bzhin du yang skye ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu la sogs pa la myu gu la sogs pa med bzhin du yang skye ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa /
translated: But if you think that although the sprout and so on does not exist in the effect and so on, it arises as a part of the conventional,ğŸ”½and that because it is seen to be the domain of the intellect of the childish, it arises ultimately as well, then the eye and so on would arise from the internal sources.

original: byis pa'i blo can spyi'i spyod yul du gyur pa mthong nas don dam par yang mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams skye bar 'dod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste skye bar smra ba gzhan dag 'di skad ces rgyu 'bru la sogs pa

translated: If you say that it arises, then others might say this: â€œThe cause, such as a seed,

analyzed: la 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa snga na med bzhin du yang skye ba kun rdzob tu gtogs pa tha na pa lang rdzi'i chung ma yan chad kyi blo'i gzung bar gyur pa snang ba las don dam par yang rgyu 'bru la sogs pa dang mer mer
translated: And the sprout and so on, which is the effect, is not present prior to its cause, such as the seed, and yet it arises. This is included within the relative. It is perceived by the minds of all, even the wife of a cowherd.

original: po la sogs pa las 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams skye mched rnams skye bar 'dod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na bram ze'i snying na mir las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /

original: 'dir ni byung ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi don du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni byung ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi don du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the term â€œarisingâ€ should be viewed as having the meaning of â€œintrinsic reality.â€

analyzed: brda sprod pa las ngo bo nyid la yang byung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the term â€œarisingâ€ is also used to refer to intrinsic reality in the grammatical treatises.

original: dper na bram ze'i snying mar gyi ngo bo nyid dang 'dra ba la mar las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bram ze'i snying mar gyi ngo bo nyid dang 'dra ba la mar las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /

original: de yang de'i snying mar gong gi dbyibs lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang de'i snying mar gong gi dbyibs lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the essence of brahminâ€™s milk is not like the shape of milk that existed previously.

original: 'di ltar myur du 'ju ba nyid kyis mar gyi ngo bo nyid dang chos mthun pa'i phyir bram ze'i snying ni mar las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar myur du 'ju ba nyid kyis mar gyi ngo bo nyid dang chos mthun pa'i phyir bram ze'i snying ni mar las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Rather, it is like the essence of milk because it is similar to milk in that it is quickly digested.

original: rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rnams kyang rang las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rnams kyang rang las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the conditions such as semen and blood do not arise from themselves.

original: rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of â€œconditions do not have the nature of conditionsâ€ is that they do not arise from themselves.

original: rkyen rnams ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar dang po kho nar rjes su dpag pağŸ”½rgya chen pos rkyen so so ba dag 'dus pa dag @210a * //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa rkyen rnams ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ltar ni sngar dang po kho nar rjes su dpag pa rgya chen pos rkyen so so ba dag 'dus pa dag @210a * //
translated: as was previously done in the first chapter,

original: gi ngo bo nyid dgag par byas zin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //ğŸ”½de'i phyir / rang byung min las 'bras bu gang //
analyzed: gi ngo bo nyid dgag par byas zin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i phyir / rang byung min las 'bras bu gang //
translated: the extensive refutation of the entityness of the assembly of individual conditions has already been done.ğŸ”½Therefore,ğŸ”½How could a result arise from conditions

original: de ni ji ltar rkyen las byung //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar rkyen las byung //
translated: If it is not self-arisen?ğŸ”½How could a result arise from conditions

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: If it is not self-arisen?

original: rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rang las byung ba ma yin pa rnams las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa gang byung ba de dag ji ltar rkyen las byung ba yin par khyed kyis brjod par nus te mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rang las byung ba ma yin pa rnams las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa gang byung ba de dag ji ltar rkyen las byung ba yin par khyed kyis brjod par nus te mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: How could you assert that a result such as the eye arises from conditions such as the semen and blood of oneâ€™s parents that are not self-arisen?

original: // don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very point, NÄgÄrjuna explains:

original: don dam par 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that ultimately the effect does not arise from conditions.

original: don dam par 'bras bu mig la sogs pa ba dag rkyen chu chu dang khrag la sogs pa las gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu mig la sogs pa ba dag rkyen chu chu dang khrag la sogs pa las gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that ultimately the effects, such as the eye, do not arise from conditions, such as water, blood, and so on.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of the verse.

original: don de gsal bar bya ba'i shes par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de gsal bar bya ba'i shes par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the understanding that clarifies that meaning, he says:

original: dper na gal te de bar ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na gal te de bar ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa yin no //
translated: For example, if Devadatta is a celibate,

original: bha ra ta ji ltar de'i bu yin zhes zer ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bha ra ta ji ltar de'i bu yin zhes zer ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba smras te /

original: 'ga' zhig gis de bhar ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa de'i bu ni bha ra ta yin no zhes bya ba smras pa na gzhan zhig na re /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis de bhar ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa de'i bu ni bha ra ta yin no zhes bya ba smras pa na gzhan zhig na re /
translated: If someone says, â€œBharata is the son of Devadatta, who has been celibate since childhood,â€ another says,

original: gal te de bha ra ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de bha ra ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa yin na /
translated: â€œIf Devadatta has been celibate since childhood,

original: bha ra ta ji ltar de'i bu yin zhes zer ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bha ra ta ji ltar de'i bu yin zhes zer ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be like saying, How is Bharata the son of Bharata?

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: dper na de bha ra ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa nyid kyis bha ra ta de'i bu yin pa de nyid bstsal ba de bzhin du rkyen rnams rkyen nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pi nyid kyis kyang de dag gis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu rkyen
analyzed: dper na de bha ra ta gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa nyid kyis bha ra ta de'i bu yin pa de nyid bstsal ba de bzhin du rkyen rnams rkyen nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pi nyid kyis kyang de dag gis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu rkyen
translated: For example, just as Bharata is the son of Bharata because he is a celibate, in the same way, because conditions are not the entity of conditions, the effect that is produced by those conditions is the effect of those conditions.

original: de dag las byung ba nyid dang / rkyen de dag las gyur pa nyid bstsal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba nyid dang / rkyen de dag las gyur pa nyid bstsal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the arising from those and the transformation from those conditions are also stated.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i 'jim pa'i gong bu 'jim pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa las skyes pa'i bum pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyi tha snyad du yang 'jim pa de las gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs par mi bzod pas zhes bya bas ni
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i 'jim pa'i gong bu 'jim pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa las skyes pa'i bum pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyi tha snyad du yang 'jim pa de las gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs par mi bzod pas zhes bya bas ni
translated: A pot that is produced from a lump of clay that is empty of the entity of that clay, which is emanated by a magician, is not able to be understood as that which is transformed from that clay even in terms of conventions of experts.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: ji ltar kho bo'i phyogs la 'jim pa la sogs pa rgyu'i dngos po thams cad dang / bum pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar kho bo'i phyogs la 'jim pa la sogs pa rgyu'i dngos po thams cad dang / bum pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as for us, all things that are causes, such as clay, and all things that are effects, such as pots, arise from causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas de'i phyir khyed kyis nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa kho nar gzung ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas de'i phyir khyed kyis nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa kho nar gzung ste /
translated: Since they are empty of intrinsic reality, you assert that the conditions of internal things exist only ultimately,

original: de dag las byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes gang smras pas dper na bum pa ni rkyen 'jim pa la sogs pa de dag las @210b byung ba'i phyir bum pa'i rkyen 'jim pa la sogs pa dag don dam par yod pa kho na yin
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes gang smras pas dper na bum pa ni rkyen 'jim pa la sogs pa de dag las @210b byung ba'i phyir bum pa'i rkyen 'jim pa la sogs pa dag don dam par yod pa kho na yin
translated: because they arise from them, like a pot. For example, since a pot arises from those conditions, such as clay, the conditions of a pot, such as clay, exist only ultimately.

original: pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi dngos po rnams kyang rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa de dag las byung ba'i phyir nang gi dngos po mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rnams kyang don dam par
analyzed: pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi dngos po rnams kyang rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa de dag las byung ba'i phyir nang gi dngos po mig la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rnams kyang don dam par
translated: So too, because internal things such as the eyes arise from conditions such as semen and blood, the conditions such as semen and blood of internal things such as the eyes exist ultimately.

original: yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni bum pa'i dpe sgyu ma lta bu de la rkyen rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni bum pa'i dpe sgyu ma lta bu de la rkyen rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yang med la /
translated: Reply: In the example of the illusion-like pot, it is not established that conditions have intrinsic reality.

original: de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub pa yang med do //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub pa yang med do //
translated: And the proof that â€œit arises from thoseâ€ does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /ğŸ”½de'i phyir rkyen las byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir / de'i phyir rkyen las byung ba ma yin /
translated: Because that is so,ğŸ”½therefore it does not arise from conditions.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen las byung pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rkyen las byung pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore it is said that the effect does not arise from conditions.

original: des na dpe med de bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs des na dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bum pa las dpe blangs pa de med de /
analyzed: des na dpe med de bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs des na dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bum pa las dpe blangs pa de med de /
translated: Since the reason explained above is that the example is like a pot, the example of a pot is not established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bum pa la bsgrub par bya ba chos rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa kho nar gzung ste zhes bya dang / sgrub pa'i chos de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gnyis ma tshangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la bsgrub par bya ba chos rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa kho nar gzung ste zhes bya dang / sgrub pa'i chos de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gnyis ma tshangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the two, the property of the position, which is that ultimately the conditions are apprehended as existent alone, and the property of the subject, which is that they arise from those conditions, are incomplete.

original: ro // de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ro // de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, as before, the meaning of the reason is not established or the meaning is contradictory.
