analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de gal te don dam par brjod na ni /
translated: If the reason â€œbecause they arise from thoseâ€ is stated ultimately,

original: don ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the meaning is not established.

original: dbu ma pa rnams la don dam par de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams la don dam par de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the Madhyamikas, the reason â€œbecause they arise from thatâ€ is not established ultimately.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid bu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid bu 'gyur te /
translated: If you say it is in terms of the conventional, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pas des don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pas des don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is said that â€œthey arise from that,â€ and the essence of the conventional is that it does not arise without a cause. Therefore, since it proves that ultimately they are essenceless, the meaning is contradictory.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis sun phyung ba'i don sgro btag pa nas smras pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis sngar dbu ma pas skye bar smra ba dag gi dpe med de zhes sun phyung ba'i don de khas blangs nas yang skye ba sgrubğŸ”½pa'i phyir smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis sun phyung ba'i don sgro btag pa nas smras pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis sngar dbu ma pas skye bar smra ba dag gi dpe med de zhes sun phyung ba'i don de khas blangs nas yang skye ba sgrubğŸ”½pa'i phyir smras pa yin no //
translated: Here, the opponentâ€™s refutation is stated in the words â€œin this context, the arising of the other . . .â€ In this context, the other, the proponent of arising, having accepted the refutation by the Madhyamika that the example of the proponent of arising is not established, again argues for the sake of establishing arising.

original: gal te 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba med pas rjes su dpag pa med par bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rkyen las byung ba med pas rjes su dpag pa med par bstan du zin kyang /
translated: If you say that because the effect does not arise from conditions, you have taught without using an inference,

original: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dod pas de ma bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dod pas de ma bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: but because we do not assert that the effect has the nature of the effect, the effect is not refuted.ğŸ”½If you say that others can also state this,

original: gzhan gyis kyang brjod par nus te zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½gal te 'bras @211a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang brjod par nus te zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te / gal te 'bras @211a * //
translated: this is taught by the line â€œbecause others can also state this.â€ğŸ”½If you say that because the effects such as the pot and the eye do not arise from conditions such as clay and the embryonic germ, there is no example,ğŸ”½and because of that, you Followers of the Middle Way have taught without using an inference,ğŸ”½but because we do not assert that the effect, such as the pot and the eye, is not refuted,ğŸ”½ Translation: à½ à½–à¾²à½¦à¼‹à½–à½´à¼‹à½“à½²à¼‹à½ à½–à¾²à½¦à¼‹à½–à½´à½ à½²à¼‹à½„à½¼à¼‹à½–à½¼à¼‹à½‰à½²à½‘à¼‹à½˜à½²à¼‹à½ à½‘à½¼à½‘à¼‹à½”à½¦à¼‹à½‘à½ºà¼‹à½˜à¼‹à½–à½€à½‚à¼‹à½”à½ à½²à¼‹à½•à¾±à½²à½¢à¼

original: bu bum pa dang mig la sogs pa de dag rkyen 'jim pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa las byung ba med pas dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bu bum pa dang mig la sogs pa de dag rkyen 'jim pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa las byung ba med pas dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: Son of a good family, those such as a pot and eyes do not arise from conditions such as clay and a lump [of clay], and therefore there is no example.

original: khyed dbu ma pas kho bo cag gi rjes su dpag pa med par bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas kho bo cag gi rjes su dpag pa med par bstan du zin kyang /
translated: You may say, â€œWe Followers of the Middle Way do not use autonomous inferences.â€ğŸ”½

original: bum pa dang mig la sogs pa 'bras bu ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dor bar yod pas 'bras bu de ma bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa dang mig la sogs pa 'bras bu ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dor bar yod pas 'bras bu de ma bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the effect, such as a vase or the eye, exists without relinquishing its own nature as an effect, that effect is not refuted.

original: kho bo cag la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gis rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang 'bras bu'i rkyen rnams yod pa nyid du sgrub par nus te zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gis rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang 'bras bu'i rkyen rnams yod pa nyid du sgrub par nus te zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: We say that because the entity of the effect exists, therefore we can prove that the conditions of the effect exist in another way.

original: de'i phyir don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the conditions of the internal sense spheres exist,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are the effect.ğŸ”½For example, it is like a sprout.

original: dper na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te 'dir yang nang gi skye mched rnams kyi zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te 'dir yang nang gi skye mched rnams kyi zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
translated: Here, the internal sense spheres is the subject.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams kyi'o //
translated: The conditions of the internal sense spheres such as the eye are the predicate.

original: rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: The conditions exist is the probandum.

original: chos can nang gi skye mched rnams la bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa khyad par can dag don dam par yod pa kho nar bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos can nang gi skye mched rnams la bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa khyad par can dag don dam par yod pa kho nar bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The subject is the inner sense bases, and the probandum is the existence of their specific conditions, such as the kalala, in the ultimate.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: The reason is â€œbecause they are effects.â€

original: gang dang gang 'bras bu yin pa de dang de la rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang 'bras bu yin pa de dang de la rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the proving property because it proves that whatever is an effect has conditions.

original: dper na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /ğŸ”½dper na myu gu la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te / dper na myu gu la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The example is â€œfor example, like a sprout.â€ğŸ”½This is applied as an example because, for example, since a sprout and so on is an effect, its conditions exist in the ultimate.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rkyen rnams kyang don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rkyen rnams kyang don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, since the inner sense bases are effects, their conditions also exist in the ultimate.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentaryğŸ”½says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /ğŸ”½rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
translated: Here it is said:

original: yod min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: yod min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: â€œAn effect arising from nonconditions does not exist.â€

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here it is said means

original: skye bar smra ba dag gi rjes su dpag pa de la 'grel pa byed pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba gnyis pas sun dbyung ba bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye bar smra ba dag gi rjes su dpag pa de la 'grel pa byed pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba gnyis pas sun dbyung ba bshad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that the author of the commentary explains that the two lines of the root text refute the inference of the proponents of arising.

original: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
translated: An effect arising from nonconditions does not exist

original: yod min zhes bya ba ni rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba dang / rkyen min pa las gyur pa dang rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu ni rgyu med pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin pas /
analyzed: yod min zhes bya ba ni rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba dang / rkyen min pa las gyur pa dang rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu ni rgyu med pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin pas /
translated: means that an effect arising from nonconditions, arising from what is not a condition, arising from what is not a condition, and an effect that is the essence of what is not a condition is an effect arising without a cause.

original: @211b de lta bu ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang yod pa ma yin na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos te med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: @211b de lta bu ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang yod pa ma yin na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos te med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Such an effect does not exist even conventionally, so what need is there to mention that it does not exist ultimately?

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: You say, â€œBecause your reason is the effect,â€ but that is not established.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that point,

original: rkyen ma yin pa las gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni tha snyad du yang rtogs par mi nus na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa las gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni tha snyad du yang rtogs par mi nus na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it says, â€œAn effect that arises from nonconditions cannot be understood even conventionally, let alone ultimately.â€

original: rkyen 'bru la sogs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa ma yin pa las gyur ba'i 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin pas de ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang yod pa nyid
analyzed: rkyen 'bru la sogs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa ma yin pa las gyur ba'i 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin pas de ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang yod pa nyid
translated: An effect such as a sprout or an eye that arises from nonconditions such as a seed or a fertilized ovum is causeless. Therefore it cannot be understood or apprehended even conventionally as existing.

original: du rtogs pa dang gzung bar mi nus na don dam par 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung ba yod pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / gzung bar nus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: du rtogs pa dang gzung bar mi nus na don dam par 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung ba yod pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / gzung bar nus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: Let alone being able to understand or apprehend an effect that arises from a cause as existing ultimately, it is not possible to do so.

original: mi nus pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi nus pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pas nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pas nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen rnams don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because your reason is a consequence, it is not established that the conditions of the internal sense sources exist ultimately.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir skye bar smra ba dag gis yang ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir skye bar smra ba dag gis yang ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa yin no //
translated: Here, â€œit is saidâ€ means that those who assert arising here say this in order to prove that essence exists.

original: gal te don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
translated: If in reality conditions are empty of the entity of conditions,

original: 'o na ni rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa grub pas 'dod pa grub po zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: 'o na ni rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa grub pas 'dod pa grub po zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag na re /
translated: then since you accept that conditions are not empty of the entity of nonconditions, then since nonconditions are established, your thesis is established.

original: de ltar gal te don dam par rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa rnams rang las byung ba ma yin pas rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te don dam par rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa rnams rang las byung ba ma yin pas rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
translated: Those who assert arising say, â€œIn that case, if in reality the conditions such as the sprout are empty of the entity of conditions, since they do not arise from themselves,

original: 'o na ni khyed dbu ma pas rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang / 'bru la sogs pa rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong bar khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni khyed dbu ma pas rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang / 'bru la sogs pa rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong bar khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa 'grub ste /
translated: But you Followers of the Middle Way accept that the conditions such as the sprout and so on are not empty of the entity of nonconditions. Therefore, since they are established as having the entity of nonconditions, our assertion is proven.

original: kho bo cag sde snod gsum gyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag sde snod gsum gyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that we who follow the three scriptural collections prove?

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: We prove that things have an entity.

original: de yang rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: That entity is the entity of nonconditions.

original: khyod nyid kyis don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bsgrubs pas rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod nyid kyis don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bsgrubs pas rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: You yourself have proven that ultimately conditions are empty of the entity of conditions. Therefore you have accepted that conditions are not empty of the entity of nonconditions.

original: des na rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid grub pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa ngo bo nyid yod par 'grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid grub pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa ngo bo nyid yod par 'grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of nonconditions is established, the existence of intrinsic reality is established, as we maintain.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: @212a * // de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: @212a * // de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: That is not good.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi sgrub pa des ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi sgrub pa des ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is not good means that by your proof, the existence of intrinsic reality is not established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which we call nonconditions is taught to be the mere negation of the nature of conditions.

original: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning of negation is taken to be an affirming negation,

original: rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi ston to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi ston to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: we say that the nature of nonconditions is not taught.

original: des ni 'di la kho bo cag dbu ma pas rkyen ma yin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin gyi rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'di la kho bo cag dbu ma pas rkyen ma yin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin gyi rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This shows that in this treatise, whatever we Followers of the Middle Way say that is in the form of a negation, such as â€œnot arisen from self,â€ is a mere negation of the entity of a condition. It is not an affirmation of the entity of a noncondition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of a negation is to be taken as an exclusion negation.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la gnas skabs thams cad du ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgag pa ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di la gnas skabs thams cad du ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgag pa ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
translated: In this treatise on the Middle Way, the negation â€œnotâ€ should be understood as an exclusion negation in all contexts.

original: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because negation is the primary focus, and because the intention is to establish nonconceptual wisdom, which is endowed with all objects of knowledge, by means of negating all the nets of conceptuality.

original: ma yin par dgag pa yongs su gzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa yongs su gzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir /
translated: If the negation were taken as an inclusion negation, then the primary focus would be on establishing something.

original: chos rnams ma skyes so zhes sgrub pas skye ba med pa ston pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos rnams ma skyes so zhes sgrub pas skye ba med pa ston pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the non-arising of phenomena is taught by the proof â€œphenomena do not arise,â€ the performance of that proof would be devoid of a final end.

original: lung las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a scripture declares, â€œIf one engages in the non-arising of form, one does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.â€

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin zhes smras pa gang yin pa des ni rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par mi ston pas khyed kyi 'dod pa mi 'grub po zhes bstan to /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin zhes smras pa gang yin pa des ni rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yod par mi ston pas khyed kyi 'dod pa mi 'grub po zhes bstan to /
translated: Therefore, since the statement â€œIt is not a conditionâ€ does not teach that the nature of a non-condition exists, your assertion is not established.

original: sbyor ba rnam par dbye pa byas nas zhes bya bas ni ji skad smos pa'i phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma de gnyis kyi don gsal bar bya ba'i shes par byed pa ston te /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par dbye pa byas nas zhes bya bas ni ji skad smos pa'i phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma de gnyis kyi don gsal bar bya ba'i shes par byed pa ston te /
translated: The phrase â€œhaving distinguished the syllogismâ€ indicates that the statement of the reason is clear with respect to the meaning of both the former and latter positions that have been mentioned.

original: 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba tha ma'i sbyor ba la phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma rnam pa gnyis su rnam par dbye ba byas nas ji skad sngar smos pa'i phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma gnyis bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba tha ma'i sbyor ba la phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma rnam pa gnyis su rnam par dbye ba byas nas ji skad sngar smos pa'i phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma gnyis bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the root verse is divided into two parts, the former and latter parts, in relation to the application of metrical feet. It should be applied as follows: â€œThe former and latter parts that were previously mentioned are explained.â€

original: de la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni mdo 'dir ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba bzhi pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni mdo 'dir ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba bzhi pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the so-called application is applied to the four metrical feet in this sutra.

original: de rnam par dbye ba byas nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba byas nas te /
analyzed: de rnam par dbye ba byas nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba byas nas te /
translated: Having divided it, means having divided it into two parts.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba bzhi pa 'di la @212b phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma gnyis su rnam par dbye ba byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba bzhi pa 'di la @212b phyogs snga ma dang phyogs phyi ma gnyis su rnam par dbye ba byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means having divided this four metrical feet into two parts, the former and latter parts.

original: de la sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba dang pos phyogs snga ma rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba dang pos phyogs snga ma rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therein, the former part is presented from the perspective of the first division of the application.

original: rkyen min zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rkyen min zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained as â€œnot a condition.â€

original: sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba dang po 'dis ni sngar skye bar smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba dang po 'dis ni sngar skye bar smra ba dag na re /
translated: The first mode of analysis shows that the Enumerators say:

original: gal te don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par rkyen rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
translated: If in the ultimate truth conditions are empty of the entityness of conditions,

original: 'o na ni rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin par grub pas 'dod pa 'grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas /ğŸ”½pha rol po'i bsam pa'i rang dbang ston te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par khas blangs pa yin pas des na rkyen ma yin par grub pas 'dod pa 'grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas / pha rol po'i bsam pa'i rang dbang ston te /
translated: then you accept that conditions are not empty of the entityness of nonconditions. Therefore, since nonconditions are established, your thesis is established.ğŸ”½This sets forth the opponentâ€™s position.

original: de'i sbyor bas ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: The second mode of analysis shows that the opponent says:

original: rkyen ma yin par grub pas mig la sogs pa'i rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod par 'gyur bas 'dod pa 'grub po zhes zer ba'i don ston to //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin par grub pas mig la sogs pa'i rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod par 'gyur bas 'dod pa 'grub po zhes zer ba'i don ston to //
translated: Since nonconditions are established, the conditions of the eye and so on, such as the condition of the nutritive essence, exist as the entityness of nonconditions. Therefore, your thesis is established.

original: sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba gnyis pas phyogs phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba gnyis pas phyogs phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second mode of analysis sets forth the latter position.

original: rkyen du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bshad de sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba gnyis pa 'dis ni sngar dbu ma pas de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba bshad de sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba gnyis pa 'dis ni sngar dbu ma pas de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This second analysis of the syllogism demonstrates the response, â€œThat is not good,

original: kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rkyen ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
translated: because we Madhyamikas teach that the mere negation of the intrinsic reality of conditions is the nonexistence of conditions.

original: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i don gyi dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because we accept the meaning of a nonimplicative negation,ğŸ”½we do not teach the intrinsic reality of nonconditions.

original: rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid mi ston to zhes lan btab pa'i phyogs phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas rkyen dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid mi ston to zhes lan btab pa'i phyogs phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas rkyen dgag pa ston te /
translated: This demonstrates the refutation of conditions from the perspective of positing the latter position.

original: de'i sbyor bas ni rkyen ma yin par grub pas mig la sogs pa'i rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag rkyen ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas 'bras bu skyed pa'i rkyen du ga la 'gyur zhes med par dgag pa'i don du bstan to ;
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas ni rkyen ma yin par grub pas mig la sogs pa'i rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag rkyen ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas 'bras bu skyed pa'i rkyen du ga la 'gyur zhes med par dgag pa'i don du bstan to ;
translated: The syllogism demonstrates that because they are established as nonconditions, the conditions of the eyes and so on, such as the motherâ€™s blood and semen, would be nonconditions. How could they be conditions that give rise to effects? This demonstrates the meaning of a nonimplicative negation.

original: / phyogs phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa de nyid brnan pa'i phyir rkyen ma yin pa rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / phyogs phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa de nyid brnan pa'i phyir rkyen ma yin pa rnams rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to emphasize that very establishment of the subsequent position, he says, â€œbecause nonconditions would not have the nature of conditions.â€

original: rkyen ma yin pa grub pas mig la sogs pa'i rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag rkyen ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas rkyen ma yin pa de rnams 'bras bu skyed pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa grub pas mig la sogs pa'i rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag rkyen ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas rkyen ma yin pa de rnams 'bras bu skyed pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don
translated: The meaning of the sentence is this: because nonconditions are established, the conditions of the embryo, etc., of the eye, etc., would not be conditions. Therefore, those nonconditions would not have the nature of conditions that produce effects.

original: te / sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba gnyis pa 'di'i don ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: te / sbyor ba rnam par dbye ba gnyis pa 'di'i don ni de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of this second analysis of the syllogism.

original: yang na ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa skye ba bstsal bas de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas na /
analyzed: yang na ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyi 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa skye ba bstsal bas de'i phyir 'bras bu med pas na /
translated: Again, because the arising of existent and nonexistent effects has been refuted in the manner explained above, therefore, since the effect does not exist,

original: 'dir ni dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don dang / dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don dang / dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don te /

analyzed: de la gzhung 'og nas byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /

analyzed: da ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan par bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te / 'grel pa byed pas ci'i phyir /

original: da ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan par bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras she na /
analyzed: da ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan par bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras she na /
translated: Why does the commentator say, â€œNow, in order to teach dependent origination as devoid of coming and going, the second chapter is begunâ€?

original: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po mdo sde dag las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po mdo sde dag las /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Since it is said, â€œAll phenomena are without coming and without going,â€

original: khyad par gyi gzhi rten cing 'brel @216b par 'byung ba khyad par 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa bstan kyang /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi rten cing 'brel @216b par 'byung ba khyad par 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa bstan kyang /
translated: the basis of distinction, dependent origination, is taught to be without coming and without going.

original: gzhan dag gis lung de tsam gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa mi rtogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis lung de tsam gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa mi rtogs pas /

original: de'i phyir 'dir rigs pas de bstan par bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rigs pas de bstan par bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that by means of reasoning, it is said that the second chapter is composed.

analyzed: dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the reason for engaging the thesis,

original: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: in the first chapter all things are taught to be unarisen. In order to dispel the discordant side, it is said that the second chapter is composed.

original: ci'i phyir / dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don yin zhe na /
translated: The term â€œby the power ofâ€ has the meaning of the cause of the promise.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa thams cad dgag par bya'o zhes dam bcas shing zhal gyis bzhes la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa thams cad dgag par bya'o zhes dam bcas shing zhal gyis bzhes la /
translated: Because the author of the treatise promised and accepted in the first chapter to refute all that is discordant with the teaching that all things are not produced.

original: de yang gang gi phyir skye ba dgag par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir skye ba dgag par mdzad nas /
translated: And because he must accomplish that by refuting arising,

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag par mdzad pas bsgrub dgos pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag par mdzad pas bsgrub dgos pa de'i phyir /

original: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de dag gi nang du gtogs pa 'gag pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de dag gi nang du gtogs pa 'gag pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang /
translated: Therefore, in the first chapter, he refutes cessation, permanence, annihilation, coming, going,

original: tha dad pa dang / don tha dad pa dang / don gcig pa zhes bya ba de dag thams cad bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa rtsom par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / don tha dad pa dang / don gcig pa zhes bya ba de dag thams cad bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa rtsom par khong du chud par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel ba byed pas kyang bstan bcos mdzad pas gzhung gong du bstan ma thag par dam bcas shing zhal gyis bzhes pa de nyid kyi sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /

original: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so //

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /

original: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / chad pa dang / rtag pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / don tha dad pa dang / don gcig pa gang dag rnam par gzhag pa de dag bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu @217a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / chad pa dang / rtag pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / don tha dad pa dang / don gcig pa gang dag rnam par gzhag pa de dag bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu @217a * //
translated: and arising, ceasing, being annihilated, being permanent, coming, going, having different meanings, and having the same meaning, are refuted by the power of the desire to explain them.

original: byed pa gnyis pa brtsams te /
analyzed: byed pa gnyis pa brtsams te /
translated: The second chapter is composed for that purpose.

original: des na dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don yin par nges so //
analyzed: des na dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don yin par nges so //
translated: Therefore, the term â€œby the power ofâ€ is ascertained to have the meaning of the cause of the commitment.

original: yang na rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, in the first chapter, the so-called â€œopposing factorsâ€ are all things that are taught to be unarisen.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa las skye bar smra ba dag gis rang rang gi phyogs snga ma ji skad smras pa dag ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa las skye bar smra ba dag gis rang rang gi phyogs snga ma ji skad smras pa dag ste /
translated: Those who propound arising from self, from other, from both, and from no cause, each state their own prior positions.

analyzed: de dag bstsal ba ni rab tu byed pa dang po 'ba' zhig gis byas par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Those are refuted not only by the first chapter alone.

original: rab tu byed pa gzhan dag gis kyang sel bar byed pas de'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gzhan dag gis kyang sel bar byed pas de'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang por dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstsal bar bzhed pa'i dbang gis rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
translated: He composed the second chapter in order to refute the counter-thesis that all things are non-arisen, which is the topic of the first chapter.

original: smras so // rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang du tshig gi don nges pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par bshad pa byed pa de ni rab tu byed pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½gzhan dag ni slob ma skye ba med pa'i rigs pa thos pas dad pa skyes pa /
analyzed: smras so // rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang du tshig gi don nges pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par bshad pa byed pa de ni rab tu byed pa zhes bya'o // gzhan dag ni slob ma skye ba med pa'i rigs pa thos pas dad pa skyes pa /
translated: A chapter is so called because it is that which explains the nature of the topics whose meaning is ascertained.ğŸ”½Others say that the second chapter was composed for the sake of those disciples who, having heard the reasoning of non-arising, have given rise to faith,

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag pa nyan 'dod pa'i don du rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsom  mo zhes rjod par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag pa nyan 'dod pa'i don du rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsom  mo zhes rjod par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and who wish to listen to the refutation of going and coming that is renowned in the world.

original: rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam pa'i skabs 'dir 'grel pa byed pa slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad ces rjod par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gnyis pa brtsam pa'i skabs 'dir 'grel pa byed pa slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad ces rjod par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In this chapter of the second chapter, the commentator BuddhapÄlita says the following.

original: de ltar yang dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa buddha p'a li ta nyid kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa buddha p'a li ta nyid kyis smras pa /
translated: Thus, BuddhapÄlitaâ€™s Commentary on the Fundamental Treatise says:

original: khyod kyi skye ba med pa'i rigs pa 'dis rjes su rab tu bstan par byas pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa las ngo mtshar snying po can du byas kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyi skye ba med pa'i rigs pa 'dis rjes su rab tu bstan par byas pas kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa las ngo mtshar snying po can du byas kyi /
translated: â€œBy your reasoning of nonarising, you have taught this well, and so my mind, which delights in listening to emptiness, has been made wondrous.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi mngon sum 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi 'thad pa de je smros shig ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi mngon sum 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi 'thad pa de je smros shig ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Please explain how coming and going are untenable in the worldâ€™s direct perception.â€

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re /
translated: Another says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas na 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de mi rung bar sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas na 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de mi rung bar sgrub pa ston to //
translated: â€œThat is not correct reasoning.â€ And so on. The commentator himself teaches the proof that the explanation of the elder BuddhapÄlita is not correct.

original: gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin par rang nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin par rang nyid yin te /
translated: â€œNot otherâ€ means not other than itself.

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the author of the commentary.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re /
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary says,

original: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œThe explanation of the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita is not correct.â€

original: ci'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not correct?

original: 'di ltar slob ma ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob ma ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Because there are three kinds of students:

original: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / the tshom can dang / ma @217b rtogs pa yin grang na /
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / the tshom can dang / ma @217b rtogs pa yin grang na /
translated: those whose minds are distorted, those who are doubtful, and those who do not understand.

original: de dag gsum char yang gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas ji skad rnam par bshad pa de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gsum char yang gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas ji skad rnam par bshad pa de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not correct to ask the question in the way that the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita explains it, because it is not correct for any of these three to ask the question in that way.

original: dal re zhig slob ma sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dal re zhig slob ma sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is not correct for a student whose mind is distorted to ask the question in that way,

original: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni de skad 'dri bar mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not proper to ask that question of one whose mind has been distorted by a semblance of valid knowledge.

original: de ni 'gro ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir dang skye ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir dang skye ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is taught that going exists and because it is taught that arising exists, it is proper to state a syllogism.

original: de la tshad ma ltar snang bas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa gsal ba ma yin pa dang de kho na ma yin pas te /
analyzed: de la tshad ma ltar snang bas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa gsal ba ma yin pa dang de kho na ma yin pas te /
translated: There, a semblance of valid knowledge is not a clear syllogism and is not reality.

original: yi ge dang tshig dang ngag shin tu rnam par ma dag pa dang / rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba 'am /
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig dang ngag shin tu rnam par ma dag pa dang / rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba 'am /
translated: It is a very impure letter, word, and speech, or it is a semblance of a syllogism.

original: yang na tshig gi bdag nyid ma yin pa dang don gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na tshig gi bdag nyid ma yin pa dang don gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: Or it is not the nature of words and it is not the nature of meaning.

original: dngos su na skye ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa yod par ston pa ste des so //
analyzed: dngos su na skye ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa yod par ston pa ste des so //
translated: In reality, it teaches that arising, coming, going, and so on exist.

original: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ltar snang ba des slob ma sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ltar snang ba des slob ma sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
translated: â€œOne whose mind has gone astrayâ€ means that the studentâ€™s mind has gone astray due to the appearance of a false means of knowledge.

original: skye ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: He is attached to the existence of arising, coming, going, and so on.

original: de skad ces 'dri ba mi rigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i slob ma de ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas ji skad rnam par bshad pa de skad 'dri ba mi rigs pa'i phyir de
analyzed: de skad ces 'dri ba mi rigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i slob ma de ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas ji skad rnam par bshad pa de skad 'dri ba mi rigs pa'i phyir de
translated: â€œBecause it is illogical to ask thatâ€ means that it is illogical for that student whose mind has gone astray due to the appearance of a false means of knowledge to ask that question in the way that the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita explains it.

original: ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir de de skad 'dri ba mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de de skad 'dri ba mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it illogical to ask that?

original: de'i phyir de ni 'gro ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'gro ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yod par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œIt is logical that he would state an inference in order to demonstrate that going exists and in order to demonstrate that arising exists.â€

original: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa de ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa bstan pa na skye ba yod par ston pa dang 'gro ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas de skad dri bar rigs so //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa de ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa bstan pa na skye ba yod par ston pa dang 'gro ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas de skad dri bar rigs so //
translated: That mind which has gone wrong is one that, when the non-arising and non-going of things are taught, remains as an opponent, by means of inferences that teach the existence of arising and the existence of going.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: tshad ma ltar snang bas sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa de ni dbu ma pa la khyod kyis skye ba med pa'i rigs pa 'di rjes su bstan par byas pas /

analyzed: kho bo'i yid stong pa nyid nyan pa la ngo mtshar snying po can du byas kyi / ji ltar 'jig rten mngon sum gyi //

analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba mi 'thad pa de je smros shig ces de skad 'dri ba mi rigs pa'i phyir / gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa @218a * //

original: ma yin no //

translated: â€œHow could it be logical for someone whose mind is confused by the appearance of valid cognition to say, â€˜Ultimately, there is no goingâ€™? Because it is illogical to ask such a question.â€ğŸ”½â€œHow could it be logical for someone whose mind is confused by the appearance of valid cognition to say, â€˜Ultimately, there is no goingâ€™?â€

original: don dam par 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba de mi rigs pas /
analyzed: don dam par 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba de mi rigs pas /
translated: Because it is illogical to say that,ğŸ”½â€œExplain how it is that going and coming through the worldâ€™s direct perception is untenable.â€

original: de yang ji ltar 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi 'thad pa de je smros shig ces de skad 'dri ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba yod dam med snyam du the tshom za ba de ni de la dad pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba yod dam med snyam du the tshom za ba de ni de la dad pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /

original: de skad 'dri ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad 'dri ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //

original: gal te the tshom bsal ba'i phyir de skad 'dri'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te the tshom bsal ba'i phyir de skad 'dri'o zhe na /

translated: Therefore the explanation of the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita is not correct.

translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not proper to ask that because the student does not understand,ğŸ”½it says:

analyzed: mi shes pa'i dri ba yin par brtag na ni bstan bcos kyi phal pa'i spyod yul yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma ma rtogs pa blo zhan pa'o //

analyzed: pa'i spyod yul yin par mi rung ngo //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin @218b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun du bzang po'i dge 'dun yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
translated: are the saá¹…gha of the BhagavÄn, the tathÄgata, the arhat, the completely perfect Buddha Samantabhadra.

original: 'dir kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re /

analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir chad pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras pa na /

original: khyed na re /
analyzed: khyed na re /

analyzed: 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'i phyir 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi skye ba yang phyis dgag par khas ma blangs par gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since cyclic existence has no beginning, we do not accept that arising is preceded by cessation, and so there is the fault that your reason is not established.

original: 'gag pa ni skye ba'i rim pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / don brtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig gzhan du byas na yang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'gag pa ni skye ba'i rim pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / don brtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshig gzhan du byas na yang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes zer te /
translated: We say: There is no fault because cessation does not depend on the order of arising, because it is a hypothetical object, and because the consequence is similar when the words are rearranged.

original: skye ba sngar 'gag pa'i tshig bzhag par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: skye ba sngar 'gag pa'i tshig bzhag par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established the words â€œarising precedes cessation,â€

original: de'i 'og tu skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i skabs su /
translated: subsequently, in the context of establishing the nonexistence of arising,ğŸ”½NÄgÄrjuna says:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //

analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //

analyzed: zhes bya bas 'gag pa bas skye ba 'gag pa sngar bsgrubs pas /
translated: Thus, since it has been established that cessation is prior to arising,

analyzed: nga yang skye ba med par bstan pa'i 'og tu 'gag pa'am chad pa med pa bstan pa'i rigs na de mi ston par /
translated: after teaching that things do not arise, it would be logical for him to teach that they do not cease or are not annihilated.ğŸ”½But he does not teach that.

original: 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i tshig gi don ston par byed pas de'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos la lan 'ga' yang ltag 'og nges pa med do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i tshig gi don ston par byed pas de'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos la lan 'ga' yang ltag 'og nges pa med do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: Instead he teaches the meaning of the words â€œnoncomingâ€ and â€œnongoing.â€ Therefore, you have been exposed as having no understanding of the sequence of the treatise.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'jig rten ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig bsal na bya ba lhag ma bsal ba yang sla
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig bsal na bya ba lhag ma bsal ba yang sla
translated: Since most worldly people are attached to the reality of action on the basis of the conventions of many actions, in order to remove the pain of such attachment, if one refutes the action that is the characteristic of going, the remaining actions are also refuted.

original: bas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, the opponentâ€™s position is stated.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: 'jig rten thams cad ni skye ba la mngon par zhen pa yin pas de'i phyir 'gag pa bas skye ba dgag par sngar bstan pa mdzad pa @219a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ni skye ba la mngon par zhen pa yin pas de'i phyir 'gag pa bas skye ba dgag par sngar bstan pa mdzad pa @219a * //
translated: Since the entire world is attached to arising, therefore, the cessation of arising was taught first.

original: bzhin du / 'dir yang 'jig rten ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhin du / 'dir yang 'jig rten ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, here also, since the world is mostly attached to the reality of action due to the power of the convention of many actions, in order to remove the dart of attachment,

original: slob dpon gyis go rims bsnor te skye ba bkag pa'i 'og tu 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dgag pa'i tshig gi don bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis go rims bsnor te skye ba bkag pa'i 'og tu 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dgag pa'i tshig gi don bstan par mdzad do //
translated: the master reverses the order and, after the cessation of arising, teaches the meaning of the words that negate coming and going.

original: de la 'jig rten ni phal cher zhes bya ba ni mi dag las phal cher zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten ni phal cher zhes bya ba ni mi dag las phal cher zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There, â€œthe world is mostlyâ€ means â€œmostly from humans.â€

original: bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œDue to the power of the convention of many actionsâ€ means:

original: bya ba mang po zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba mang po'i phyir te bya ba mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba mang po zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba mang po'i phyir te bya ba mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œMany activitiesâ€ means because of many worldly activities; the meaning is â€œinfinite activities.â€

original: tha snyad ces bya ba ni g-yo zhing spyod pa'i tha snyad de /
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba ni g-yo zhing spyod pa'i tha snyad de /
translated: â€œConventionâ€ means the convention of deceptive conduct.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang 'dug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mang po'i tha snyad yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang 'dug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mang po'i tha snyad yod pa'o //
translated: â€œIn all the worldâ€ means that there is the convention of many activities, such as coming, going, and sitting.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba ni bya ba mang po'i tha snyad de'i dbang gis te de'i mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba ni bya ba mang po'i tha snyad de'i dbang gis te de'i mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œBy the power ofâ€ means by the power of the convention of many activities; the meaning is â€œby its force.â€

original: bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang des 'ong ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ni phal cher bya ba mang po'i tha snyad kyi dbang des 'ong ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: â€œBecause of attachment to the reality of activityâ€ means that the world is for the most part attached to the reality of activity, such as coming and going, by the power of that convention of many activities.

original: 'jig rten tha na ba lang rdzi'i chung ma'i mthar thug pa thams cad 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus tshun chang nas bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten tha na ba lang rdzi'i chung ma'i mthar thug pa thams cad 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus tshun chang nas bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: All worldly people, even the wives of cowherds, have been accustomed to the attachment to the reality of action since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa de nyid mda' dug ma dang 'dra bas na zug rngu zhes bya ste de dag dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu de bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa de nyid mda' dug ma dang 'dra bas na zug rngu zhes bya ste de dag dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to remove the dart of attachment, that is, in order to stop that very attachment to the reality of action, which is like a poisoned dart.

original: 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig bsal na zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mang po dag la 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig je bkag na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig bsal na zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mang po dag la 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gcig je bkag na'o //
translated: If one action characterized as going is stopped, then all other actions are stopped as well, because the other actions of coming, and so on, are included in the action of going.

original: bya ba lhag ma dag bsal ba yang bslabs zhes bya bas ni skye ba'i bya ba dang 'chad pa'i bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma gzhan dag dgag pa yang bslabs pas so //
analyzed: bya ba lhag ma dag bsal ba yang bslabs zhes bya bas ni skye ba'i bya ba dang 'chad pa'i bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma gzhan dag dgag pa yang bslabs pas so //
translated: The remaining actions, such as the action of arising and the action of ceasing, are also stopped by the refutation of the action of going.

original: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dgag pa byed 'dod pas phyogs snga ma med pa dgag pa brjod par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dgag pa byed 'dod pas phyogs snga ma med pa dgag pa brjod par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since one who wishes to refute cannot express a negation of nonexistence,

original: 'dir dang por bya ba'i dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dir dang por bya ba'i dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag go //
translated: therefore, here first the opponent is posited, which is incompatible with nonexistence.

original: phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that positing of the opponent,

original: 'di la skabs kyi don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa snang ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di la skabs kyi don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa snang ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, â€œHere, the incompatible position appears in the context.â€

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos la'o //
translated: â€œHereâ€ refers to the treatise of the middle way.

original: skabs kyi don zhes bya ba ni sngar dam bcas @219b shing sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: skabs kyi don zhes bya ba ni sngar dam bcas @219b shing sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i don te /
translated: â€œThe incompatible position in the contextâ€ refers to the previously stated thesis and proof,

original: dngos po rnams skye ba med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye ba med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: which is, â€œThings do not arise from themselves.â€

original: don de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa snang ste zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i don de'i dgra bo phyogs su gyur pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: don de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa snang ste zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i don de'i dgra bo phyogs su gyur pa yod pa ste /
translated: The phrase â€œthe appearance of that which is discordant with that meaningâ€ refers to the existence of that which is discordant with the meaning of non-arising, which is the opponent of that meaning.

original: dngos po rnams skye ba yod par smra ba dag snang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye ba yod par smra ba dag snang ba'o //

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that which is discordant with the meaning of non-arising?

original: de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, the opponent says, â€œinternal things are only produced because they are the objects of conventional expressions.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te de ltar lung dang rigs pas skye ba med pa bsgrubs su zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te de ltar lung dang rigs pas skye ba med pa bsgrubs su zin kyang /

analyzed: yang skye bar smra ba dag dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te zhes phyir zlog par byed pa ni skabs kyi don gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dir yang nang gi dngos po rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /

analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams don dam par ma skyes pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin no //

original: de dag dang 'brel zhing ldan pa lus dang mgo dang lkog ma dang mchu dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i tshogs 'gro ba'i byed pa dang ldan pa'o //

translated: The term â€œgoingâ€ is used for the collection of body, head, throat, lips, hands, feet, etc.ğŸ”½In the same way, the term â€œgoingâ€ is used for the collection of eyes, etc., which possess their objects, and for the collection of body, head, throat, lips, hands, feet, etc.

analyzed: de dag kyang skyes pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the term â€œgoingâ€ is used for the collection of eyes, etc., which possess their objects, and for the collection of body, head, throat, lips, hands, feet, etc.

original: de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu dang mjug bsdu ba yin no //

translated: Therefore, internal things are only produced. This is the result of the valid cognition and the conclusion.

translated: In order to refute the opponentâ€™s position,

original: nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba kho na yin te /
translated: â€œInternal things are only produced,

analyzed: de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are designated as the objects of those . . .â€

analyzed: 'di la gang mi skye ba ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad mi byed de /

analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu 'gro bar mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the son of a barren woman, who does not go.
