translated: Devadatta and Viá¹£á¹‡u, the friend, do not do that, therefore internal things are only produced.â€

original: phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa de bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa de bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term â€œin order to refute thatâ€ means in order to reject that.

original: 'di bshad de zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rigs pa 'og ma dag bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di bshad de zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rigs pa 'og ma dag bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term â€œthis is explainedâ€ is connected with the term â€œthe following reasonings are explainedâ€ by the author of the commentary.ğŸ”½If the practice of generosity, morality, meditative concentration, etc., and the worldly activities of coming and going were established, then the practice of that which is established would be established.

original: gal te sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan la sogs pa'i sgrub par gyur pa skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'jig rten la grags pa dag sgrub pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan la sogs pa'i sgrub par gyur pa skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'jig rten la grags pa dag sgrub pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The term â€œgenerosity, morality, meditative concentration, etc.â€ indicates the following.

original: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang shes rab gang dag gi / dang por sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan smos pa de dag ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang shes rab gang dag gi / dang por sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan smos pa de dag ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bsam gtan la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The practice of generosity, morality, meditative concentration, etc., is mentioned first, and then the practice of patience, perseverance, and wisdom.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin la /
translated: The three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience are the accumulation of merit.

original: bsam @220b gtan dang shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin /
analyzed: bsam @220b gtan dang shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin /
translated: The two perfections of meditative concentration and wisdom are the accumulation of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnyi gar 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnyi gar 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The perfection of effort is common to both.

original: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis po dag bstan to //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis po dag bstan to //
translated: Thus the two accumulations of merit and wisdom are taught.

original: de dag gis bsgrub par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bsgrub par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œThey are the cause of accomplishmentâ€ means they are the cause of the accumulation.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, â€œbirth, going, and coming.â€

original: ci'i phyir de dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub par gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub par gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they the cause of the accumulation of merit and wisdom?

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa nam mkha'i autpala sogs pa dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'i sgrub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa nam mkha'i autpala sogs pa dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'i sgrub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because birth, going, and coming are not like the sky flower, etc., which are not the cause of the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: sbyin pa po dang rdzas dang len pa po la sogs pa skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod pa gzhan gyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dag la legs par sbyar bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang rdzas dang len pa po la sogs pa skye ba dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod pa gzhan gyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dag la legs par sbyar bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others who have birth, going, and coming can properly engage in the perfections such as generosity.

original: skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'jig rten la grags pa dag la sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba 'jig rten la grags pa dag la sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you prove birth, going, and coming that are renowned in the world, you are proving what is already established.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'jig rten ba lang rdzi'i chung ma yan chad la grags pa dag / gal te khyed kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni de lta na grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'jig rten ba lang rdzi'i chung ma yan chad la grags pa dag / gal te khyed kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni de lta na grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If you prove birth, going, and coming that are renowned in the world, from cowherds to their wives, and you do so conventionally, then you commit the error of proving what is already established.

original: 'on te don dam par rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin de nyid mthong ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin de nyid mthong ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: But if you do so ultimately, from the perspective of the wisdom eye of a yogi who is in equipoise, who sees the suchness of things just as it is,

original: skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub na ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub na ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you prove that birth, going, and coming exist, then the meaning of the reason, â€œbecause one engages in verbal conventions that have those as objects,â€ is not established.

original: rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa don dam pa'i bden pa la nges par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa don dam pa'i bden pa la nges par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œThe yogi/nÄ« who is equipoisedâ€ means the yogi/nÄ« who is definitely abiding in ultimate truth.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: â€œSeeing with the eye of wisdom the suchness of things just as it isâ€ means â€œwithout an object.â€

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid mthong ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i tshul nyid kyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid mthong ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i tshul nyid kyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, seeing suchness just as it is is seeing by way of the absence of an object.

original: rnal 'byor pa de'i dbang du byas te khyed cag don dam par skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub na ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyidğŸ”½de zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar sgrub na don dam par skye ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan @221a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de'i dbang du byas te khyed cag don dam par skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub na ni de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar sgrub na don dam par skye ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan @221a * //
translated: In response to the yogi, if you were to prove that ultimately arising, going, and coming exist, then the meaning of your reason â€œbecause it is a convention that possesses an objectâ€ would not be established.

original: tshigs kyi don de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If you were to prove it in that way, then because ultimately arising and so on are not established, the meaning of your reason â€œbecause it is a convention that possesses an objectâ€ would be flawed by the error of having an unestablished basis.

original: gzhi ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu'ang ma zad kyi gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu'ang ma zad kyi gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa yang yin te /
translated: Not only is it flawed by the error of having an unestablished basis, it is also flawed by the error of not being established for either party.

original: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is that?

original: 'gro ba yang skye ba dgag pa kho na bzhin du dgag pas 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang skye ba dgag pa kho na bzhin du dgag pas 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since going is refuted because arising is refuted, just like going.

original: gang la dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa de la 'gro ba la sogs pa yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa de la 'gro ba la sogs pa yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all things are not arisen, going and so on are also not arisen.

original: spyi'i rnam pas gnyis ka'i phyogs la grags pa gtan tshigs su rtog na yang zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pas gnyis ka'i phyogs la grags pa gtan tshigs su rtog na yang zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Even if you imagine a reason that is renowned in both systems through a general statement, the response is as follows.

original: gal te skye bar smra ba dag 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pa la yang kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par grub la /
analyzed: gal te skye bar smra ba dag 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pa la yang kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par grub la /
translated: If proponents of arising say, You Followers of the Middle Way accept that arising and coming exist conventionally,

original: kho bo cag la yang don dam par skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par grub pas de'i phyir spyi'i rnam pas gnyis ka'i phyogs la grags pa'i gtan tshigs yod pas /
analyzed: kho bo cag la yang don dam par skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par grub pas de'i phyir spyi'i rnam pas gnyis ka'i phyogs la grags pa'i gtan tshigs yod pas /
translated: and we also accept that ultimately arising, going, and coming exist, then your reason is one that is renowned in both systems.

original: kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs yin par rtog go zhes zer na /ğŸ”½de yang mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs yin par rtog go zhes zer na / de yang mi rung bar ston to //
translated: This is the reason.

original: gal te de ltar rtog na ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog na ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
translated: If you think in that way, why is it not tenable?

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, â€œBecause there is no pervasion.â€

original: gal te de ltar rtog na de la yang khyod la don dam par skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang sgrub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog na de la yang khyod la don dam par skye ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang sgrub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: If you think in that way, then in that case, because you have no reason that proves that ultimately going and coming exist and you have no example that is pervaded by that probandum,

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyis skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyis skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: your reason is faulty because its meaning is contradictory. Therefore it is not tenable.

original: gal te de lta na gtan tshigs kyi don de dpe ma tshang ba nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gtan tshigs kyi don de dpe ma tshang ba nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then it should be said that the meaning of your reason is incomplete with respect to the example.

original: 'gal ba nyid ces brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid ces brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: But it should not be said that it is contradictory.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la de rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la de rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, since it is only in the discordant side that the meaning of the reason is found, it is contradictory.

original: 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½kun rdzob kyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun rdzob 'ba' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / kun rdzob kyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun rdzob 'ba' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: This is what is being taught.ğŸ”½The application of a conventional reason is only found in the conventional, which is the discordant side of the ultimate.

original: des na kun rdzob kho nar skye ba la sogs pa dag yod par sgrub pa yin pas de'i phyir khyed don dam par 'gro ba la sogs pa yod par 'dod pa nyams pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na kun rdzob kho nar skye ba la sogs pa dag yod par sgrub pa yin pas de'i phyir khyed don dam par 'gro ba la sogs pa yod par 'dod pa nyams pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it establishes that arising and so on exist only conventionally, your assertion that going and so on exist ultimately is undermined. Thus the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: de ltar na pha rol po'i sgrub pa de ni grub pa @221b la sgrub pa dang / gzhi ma grub pa dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang dpe ma tshang ba dang / 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon chags pa yin pas de ni dam bcas pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol po'i sgrub pa de ni grub pa @221b la sgrub pa dang / gzhi ma grub pa dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang dpe ma tshang ba dang / 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon chags pa yin pas de ni dam bcas pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Therefore, it is just a thesis.

original: ma grub po yang bshad pa zhes bya bas ni bstan bcos mdzad pas 'gro ba dgag pa'i rigs pa gzhan dag gsungs pa ston to ;ğŸ”½/'di la gal te don dam par 'gro ba yod par gyur na de song ba'am ma song ba'am bgom pa la yod par gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: ma grub po yang bshad pa zhes bya bas ni bstan bcos mdzad pas 'gro ba dgag pa'i rigs pa gzhan dag gsungs pa ston to ; /'di la gal te don dam par 'gro ba yod par gyur na de song ba'am ma song ba'am bgom pa la yod par gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase â€œand other explanationsâ€ indicates that the author of the treatise states other reasonings to refute going.

original: 'gro ba dgag par dam bcas pa spyi bkod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba dgag par dam bcas pa spyi bkod pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œIf going existed ultimately, it would exist on that being gone over, on that not yet gone over, or on that being traversedâ€ indicates the general statement of the thesis refuting going.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spyir bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase â€œin that regardâ€ indicates the general statement.

original: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gsum po dag gis go rims sngar bkod pa de la'o //
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gsum po dag gis go rims sngar bkod pa de la'o //
translated: The three paths of going, called â€œthat gone over,â€ â€œnot yet gone over,â€ and â€œthat being gone over,â€ are arranged in that order.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni lam gyi rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba mtha' dag kyang dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni lam gyi rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba mtha' dag kyang dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ is stated in order to refute all going that is different from the substance of the path.

original: kun rdzob tu yang lam gyi rdzas las gzhan pa'i dngos po snga ma snga ma stong zhing yul phyi ma phyi mar son par byed pa'i 'gro ba dag med par ston to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang lam gyi rdzas las gzhan pa'i dngos po snga ma snga ma stong zhing yul phyi ma phyi mar son par byed pa'i 'gro ba dag med par ston to //
translated: It shows that even conventionally there is no going that is a thing different from the substance of the path, and that the previous thing is empty of the later thing that is being gone over.

original: re zhig song la 'gro med de //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig song la 'gro med de // zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no going where one has gone.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bstsal ba de song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gsum po dag las re zhig je song ba la 'gro ba med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bstsal ba de song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gsum po dag las re zhig je song ba la 'gro ba med par ston pa yin no //
translated: The word â€œwhereâ€ is a particle. It shows that, from among the three paths of going called â€œthat gone over,â€ â€œnot yet gone over,â€ and â€œthat being gone over,â€ there is no going where one has gone.

original: song la 'gro med de zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: song la 'gro med de zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: â€œThere is no going where one has goneâ€ means that there is no going on the path where one has gone.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la 'gro ba'i bya ba 'dis zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'i bya ba 'dis zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because it is that which is taken hold of by the action of going.ğŸ”½But since that meaning is also accepted by others, it need not be established.

original: don de ni gzhan dag la yang grags pas bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa'i don de ni gzhan pha rol po dag la yang grags pas 'dir bsgrub par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don de ni gzhan dag la yang grags pas bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa'i don de ni gzhan pha rol po dag la yang grags pas 'dir bsgrub par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement â€œthere is no going on a path that has been gone overâ€ is also accepted by others, the counterparts, so it need not be established here.

original: 'o na de 'dir smos ci dgos she na /
analyzed: 'o na de 'dir smos ci dgos she na /
translated: If that is so, then why is it mentioned here?

original: de phyir de smos pa ni gzhan 'dod pa'i dpe nyid du bzhed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de phyir de smos pa ni gzhan 'dod pa'i dpe nyid du bzhed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is stated: it is accepted as an example for what is accepted by others.

original: song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa de smos pa ni 'gro bar smra ba gzhan ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba yod par 'dod pa dgag pa'i dpe nyid du slob dpon bzhed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa de smos pa ni 'gro bar smra ba gzhan ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba yod par 'dod pa dgag pa'i dpe nyid du slob dpon bzhed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement â€œthere is no going on a path that has been gone overâ€ is accepted by the master as an example for refuting the assertion of other proponents of going that going exists on a path not yet gone over.

original: ji ltar song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med par gzhan dag la yang grags pa de bzhin du ma song ba'i lam la yang 'gro ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med par gzhan dag la yang grags pa de bzhin du ma song ba'i lam la yang 'gro ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is well known to others that there is no going on the path where one has gone, so too there is no going on the path where one has not gone.

original: ji ltar na song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa de ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa'i dpe nyid du bzhed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa de ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa'i dpe nyid du bzhed ce na /
translated: Why does he assert that the path where one has gone is an example of the path where one has not gone, in that there is no going?

original: de'i phyir / @222a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir / @222a * //
translated: To explain this, he says:

original: de'i chos ni lam nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i chos ni lam nyid yin la /
translated: The path itself is the property

original: ma song ba yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma song ba yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: of that, and that which has not been gone over is similar to that.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam de'i'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the path where one has gone.

original: chos ni zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam de la 'gro ba med par sgrub pa'i chos te gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: chos ni zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam de la 'gro ba med par sgrub pa'i chos te gtan tshigs so //
translated: â€œPropertyâ€ refers to the property of the path where one has gone, in that there is no going. It is the reason.

original: lam nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med par sgrub pa'i chos ni lam nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: lam nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med par sgrub pa'i chos ni lam nyid yin pa ste /
translated: â€œThe path itself is the propertyâ€ means that the property of the path where one has gone, in that there is no going, is the path itself.

original: de la 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med de lam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med de lam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here the syllogism is: â€œWith regard to the path where one has gone, there is no going, because it is a path.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the path that has been traversed, other than that which is being traversed.

original: ma song ba'i yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma song ba'i yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The path that has not yet been traversed is also similar to that.

original: ma song ba'i lam gyi chos kyang lam nyid yin par 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: ma song ba'i lam gyi chos kyang lam nyid yin par 'dra ba ste /
translated: The property of the path that has not yet been traversed is similar to the path itself.

original: des na 'dir yang sbyor ba'i tshig ni ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med de lam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'dir yang sbyor ba'i tshig ni ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med de lam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the statement of the syllogism here is: Going does not exist on the path that has not yet been traversed because it is a path.

original: dper na song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the path that has been traversed.

original: de'i phyir / ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma song ba la'ang 'gro ba med de /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the meaning of the statement â€œGoing does not exist on the path that has not yet been traversedâ€ is that

original: lam yin pa'i phyir song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is like the path that has been traversed because it is a path.

original: 'dir yang ma song ba la'ang zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te ma song ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ma song ba la'ang zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te ma song ba'i lam la'o //
translated: Here the subject is â€œgoing does not exist on the path that has not yet been traversed.â€

original: 'gro ba med ces bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te chos can ma song ba'i lam de la don dam par 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba chos khyad par can de bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba med ces bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te chos can ma song ba'i lam de la don dam par 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba chos khyad par can de bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase â€œthere is no goingâ€ is the predicate of the probandum, because the special quality of the predicate is that there is no ultimate going on the path that has not yet been traversed.

original: lam yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œbecause it is a pathâ€ is the reason that proves the predicate.

original: ma song ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir de la 'gro ba med do zhes sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: ma song ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir de la 'gro ba med do zhes sgrub par byed do //
translated: The reason proves that there is no going on the path that has not yet been traversed.

original: song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: song ba'i lam bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase â€œjust like a path that has been traversedâ€ is the example.

original: dper na song ba'i lam ni lam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na song ba'i lam ni lam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because a path that has been traversed is a path, there is no going on it.

original: de la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du ma song ba'i lam yang lam yin pa'i phyir de la 'gro ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du ma song ba'i lam yang lam yin pa'i phyir de la 'gro ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: In the same way, because a path that has not yet been traversed is a path, there is no going on it. This is the intended meaning.

original: yang na ma song ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa ste zhes bya ba ni yang na ma song ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni da dung 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na ma song ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa ste zhes bya ba ni yang na ma song ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni da dung 'gro ba'i bya ba ma brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Or else, that which is called â€œthe path not yet goneâ€ is where the action of going has not yet begun.

original: des ni chos can bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chos can bstan to //
translated: This indicates the subject.ğŸ”½The property of that is â€œnot yet gone,â€ which is the reason.

original: de'i chos ni ma song ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma byed par 'dod pa'i tshad ma nyid ni rigs pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i chos ni ma song ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma byed par 'dod pa'i tshad ma nyid ni rigs pa yin pas /
translated: Since it is logical that the valid cognition that is asserted to be valid cognition is valid,

original: 'dir ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: 'dir ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs la /
translated: here, in the position that â€œthere is no going on the path not yet gone,â€

original: phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs su bzung ba ni ma song ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs su bzung ba ni ma song ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the property of the position is taken as the reason.

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te /
translated: The example is in terms of the property of the probandum and the property of the proof.

original: gnyi ga la grags pa'i @222b chos dang ldan pa'i chos can 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin na ni zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ston to //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grags pa'i @222b chos dang ldan pa'i chos can 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin na ni zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i dpe ston to //
translated: â€œIf the path that is not asserted to be gone has the property of the subject that is renowned to both partiesâ€ indicates the example that is similar.

original: de la dpe ni zhes bya ba ni ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: de la dpe ni zhes bya ba ni ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example is the example of the nonexistence of going on a path not yet gone over.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis bstan dgos te /
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis bstan dgos te /
translated: It must be shown by the power of the property to be established and the establishing property.

original: ji skad du dpe gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro bas khyab par byed pa yod pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du dpe gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro bas khyab par byed pa yod pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said, â€œThat example in which the property to be established and the reason are pervaded by the property to be established is a similar example.â€

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba chos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid chos yin pas bsgrub par bya ba chos te /
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba chos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid chos yin pas bsgrub par bya ba chos te /
translated: The property to be established is the property to be established.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: skabs 'dir ni 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: In this context, it is connected with the phrase â€œthe nonexistence of going.â€

original: sgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med pa sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs te de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med pa sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs te de yang gang zhe na /
translated: The establishing property is the establishing property of the nonexistence of going, which is the reason. What is that?

original: skabs 'dir ni ma song ba nyid ces bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni ma song ba nyid ces bya ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: In this context, it is connected with the phrase â€œthat not yet gone.â€

original: de gnyis kyi dbang gis te zhes bya ba ni chos can ma song ba'i lam gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos 'gro ba med pa yod pa'i dbang dang sgrub pa'i chos ma song ba nyid yod pa'i dbang gis chos can de'i dpe 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dbang gis te zhes bya ba ni chos can ma song ba'i lam gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos 'gro ba med pa yod pa'i dbang dang sgrub pa'i chos ma song ba nyid yod pa'i dbang gis chos can de'i dpe 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i
translated: The phrase â€œdue to the power of those twoâ€ means that due to the power of the subject not having gone to the path and the predicate not having gone to the object, and due to the power of the proving property not having gone, the subject is not asserted to be an instance of the predicate.

original: lam gzhan bstan dgos te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam gzhan bstan dgos te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œBy the power of bothâ€ means that, by the power of the existence of the probandum, the property to be established, on a subject that is not gone to the path, and by the power of the existence of the non-goer, the proving property, it is necessary to teach another example of a subject that is not gone to the path, which is not accepted as gone to the path.ğŸ”½This is what it means.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, â€œA subject that possesses a property that is renowned to both.â€

original: chos can ma song ba'i lam gang la rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i bsgrub pa'i chos ma song ba nyid dang ldan pa dper bstan dgos pa'o //
analyzed: chos can ma song ba'i lam gang la rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i bsgrub pa'i chos ma song ba nyid dang ldan pa dper bstan dgos pa'o //
translated: It is necessary to teach an example of a subject that is not gone to the path, on which the probandum, the property to be established, is not gone to the path, which is renowned to both the proponent and the opponent, and which possesses the proving property, the non-goer, that is renowned to both the proponent and the opponent.

original: de lta bu'i chos can dper bstan du rung ba de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos can dper bstan du rung ba de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that suitable example of a subject?

original: de'i phyir 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is like a path that is not desired to be traversed.

original: ma song ba'i lam de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: ma song ba'i lam de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin no //
translated: That path not traversed is a path that is not desired to be traversed, other than that.

original: lam de la yang gnyi ga la grags pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos ma song ba nyid ces bya ba yod pas de'i phyir dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: lam de la yang gnyi ga la grags pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos ma song ba nyid ces bya ba yod pas de'i phyir dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te /
translated: And in that path, both the probandum, the property to be established, called â€œabsence of going,â€ and the proving property, called â€œnot having been traversed,â€ exist. Therefore, the example is in terms of the probandum and the proving property.

original: gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The subject, the path that is not desired to be traversed, possesses the property that is renowned to both parties.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni ma song ba la 'gro ba med par bstan pa'i skabs 'dir rjes su dpag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe dang @223a * //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni ma song ba la 'gro ba med par bstan pa'i skabs 'dir rjes su dpag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe dang @223a * //
translated: Here, â€œinferenceâ€ refers to the reason, the example, and the application that are stated in this context of demonstrating that there is no going on that not yet traversed.

original: ldan pa sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ldan pa sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The words â€œendowed withâ€ are applied to the following: the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: ma song ba la 'gro ba med de ma song ba yin pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½dper na de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no zhes pa la /
analyzed: ma song ba la 'gro ba med de ma song ba yin pa'i phyir / dper na de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no zhes pa la /
translated: There is no going where one has gone because one has already gone there.ğŸ”½There is no going where one has not gone because one has not gone there.ğŸ”½There is no going where one goes because going has no parts.

original: 'dir yang ma song ba la zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang ma song ba la zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, â€œwhere one has not goneâ€ is the subject.

original: 'gro ba med de zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba med de zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: â€œThere is no goingâ€ is the predicate of the probandum.

original: ma song ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /ğŸ”½dper na de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: ma song ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin / dper na de las gzhan pa 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: â€œBecause one has not gone thereâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œFor example, like a path where one does not want to go that is other than thatâ€ is the example.

original: dper na ma song ba'i lam de las gzhan pa'i 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam ni ma song ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na ma song ba'i lam de las gzhan pa'i 'gro bar mi 'dod pa'i lam ni ma song ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a path where one does not want to go that is other than that path where one has not gone is where one has not gone because one has not gone there.

original: de la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du ma song ba'i lam nyid kyang ma song ba yin pa'i phyir de la yang 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du ma song ba'i lam nyid kyang ma song ba yin pa'i phyir de la yang 'gro ba med do //
translated: Just as there is no going on that not yet gone over, so too there is no going on that being gone over, because that being gone over is not the not yet gone over.

original: 'di la 'ug pa pa dag na re /
analyzed: 'di la 'ug pa pa dag na re /
translated: Here the owl-man says:

original: ci ma song ba de la lhas byin 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba med par ston tam /
analyzed: ci ma song ba de la lhas byin 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba med par ston tam /
translated: Is it that Devadatta does not go on that not yet gone over because the action of going has not yet arisen?ğŸ”½Or is it that he does not go on that not yet gone over because the action of going does not exist?

original: 'on te 'gro ba'i bya ba med pas 'gro ba med par ston zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'i sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i skabs 'di la mu stegs bye brag pa'i nang nas 'ug pa pa zhes bya ba rdzas su 'dod pa dag gis bstan bcos
analyzed: 'on te 'gro ba'i bya ba med pas 'gro ba med par ston zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'i sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i skabs 'di la mu stegs bye brag pa'i nang nas 'ug pa pa zhes bya ba rdzas su 'dod pa dag gis bstan bcos
translated: This is the occasion for the author of the treatise to teach, for the owl-man, a tÄ«rthika from among the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas who assert that substances exist,

original: mdzad pas dam bcas pa'i don de rnam par brtags nas skyon 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mdzad pas dam bcas pa'i don de rnam par brtags nas skyon 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: having analyzed the meaning of the thesis of the treatise author, raises objections.

original: de'i phyir ci ma song ba de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas gal gnyis dris so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ma song ba de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas gal gnyis dris so //
translated: Therefore, the two alternatives â€œon that not yet gone overâ€ and so on are asked.

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: phyir brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir brtag pa yin no //
translated: This is an investigation.

original: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma song ba'i lam de la 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba med pa ni 'jig rten thams cad la grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma song ba'i lam de la 'gro ba'i bya ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba med pa ni 'jig rten thams cad la grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you assert the former analysis, then it is a proof of what is already established, because it is established for all worldly people that there is no going on a path not yet traversed, since the action of going has not yet arisen there.

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas nyes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ma song ba gang yin pa de 'gro ba'i bya ba phyis skye bas 'gro bar 'jig rten na mthong ba de'i phyir khyod kyisğŸ”½de 'gro ba'i bya ba phyis skye bas kyang 'gro ba med pa phyogs su byas pas de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas nyes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ma song ba gang yin pa de 'gro ba'i bya ba phyis skye bas 'gro bar 'jig rten na mthong ba de'i phyir khyod kyis de 'gro ba'i bya ba phyis skye bas kyang 'gro ba med pa phyogs su byas pas de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you assert the latter analysis, then the meaning of the reason is contradictory, because the error is that since the action of going arises later on that not yet traversed, it is seen in the world that one goes.

original: des na gtan tshigs snga ma'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs snga ma'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since you assert that there is no going on that not yet traversed, you should not say that the action of going arises later.ğŸ”½Since you assert that there is no going on that not yet traversed, you should not say that the action of going arises later.ğŸ”½Therefore, the meaning of the former reason is not unestablished.

original: 'gro ba yod pa @223b des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs snga ma de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa @223b des na kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs snga ma de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Since there is going, our previous arguments are endowed with a subject, and therefore the meaning of â€œunprovenâ€ is not applicable.

original: gal te rdzas las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ma grub pas de rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'ug pa pa dag gi dbu ma pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //

translated: If you say that it is not correct because going that is different from the goer is not established, this is a statement anticipating an objection by the owl-like MÄdhyamika.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces /
translated: If the Buddhist says,

original: kho bo cag ni gang gi gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ba 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gro ba lus las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par brtag pa dang bral bar 'gog par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni gang gi gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ba 'jig rten la grags pa'i 'gro ba lus las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par brtag pa dang bral bar 'gog par mi byed kyi /
translated: â€œWe do not refute going that is different or not different from the body, which is free from the conception of going that would make the meaning of our reason contradictory to what is renowned in the world,

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag don dam par 'gro ba 'gog par byed pas des na khyed kyis bye brag gi tshig gis don drug po rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang dag brtags pa lcags kyi thur ma ltar ngo bo nyid tha dad pa de dag gis rdzas kyi tshig gi don 'degs pa dang /ğŸ”½'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang pa dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba las kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ma grub pas 'ug pa pa dag na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag don dam par 'gro ba 'gog par byed pas des na khyed kyis bye brag gi tshig gis don drug po rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang dag brtags pa lcags kyi thur ma ltar ngo bo nyid tha dad pa de dag gis rdzas kyi tshig gi don 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang pa dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba las kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa de ma grub pas 'ug pa pa dag na re /
translated: In this way, we refute going ultimately, and therefore the meaning of the word â€œgoingâ€ is not established.

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal pa nyid yin bas des na gtan tshigs snga ma'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zer ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na zhes 'ug pa pa dag gis dbu
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal pa nyid yin bas des na gtan tshigs snga ma'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zer ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na zhes 'ug pa pa dag gis dbu
translated: If you assert the latter analysis, then the meaning of the reason is contradictory, and therefore the meaning of the former reason is not unestablished.ğŸ”½This is illogical.

original: ma pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //

original: gal te khyed dbu ma pa dag de skad ces zer na /

analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs snga ma de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pas nang gi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma sngar bzhag pa ma grub po zhes bya

translated: Some of our schools say that going is the arising of a collection of primary elements and derivative form in another place without interruption, generated by the wind element that is produced by exertion that arises from intention.

original: par skye ba 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya'o zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /

original: rlung gi khams las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs lus zhes bya ba yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye bar 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ste /

translated: The arising of a collection of primary elements and derivative form called the body in another place without interruption is called going.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa med la /
translated: Therefore, even conventionally, going does not exist as a different object.

translated: Since there is no going ultimately, it is not right for the Madhyamika to refute going that is a different object, because he would incur the fault of proving what is already established.

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs de ni lus zhes bya'o //
translated: That collection of elements and element derivatives is called â€œbody.â€

original: rlung gi khams las lus de yul nas yul gzhan du skye ba dang bar chad med par rgyun chags su skye ba 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams las lus de yul nas yul gzhan du skye ba dang bar chad med par rgyun chags su skye ba 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The arising of that body in another place from the wind element, and the arising of that body in another place without interruption, is called â€œgoing.â€

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur pa med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis brtags pa ltar med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur pa med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis brtags pa ltar med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no other world, as the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas imagine.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skye ba'i yul nyid du skye bar byed pa 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni lus yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba tsam la bya na /
translated: If â€œworldâ€ refers to the mere uninterrupted arising of the body in another place,

analyzed: lus ni gang du skye ba'i yul de nyid du 'jig pa'i phyir 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur pa med do //

analyzed: de'i phyir me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul @226a * //
translated: Therefore, because the world is a delusion, like a flame,

analyzed: pa yin pas 'gro ba don gzhan du khas mi len to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: we do not accept that the world is another world.

original: me lce dang chu rgyun la sogs pa yang gang du skyes pa'i yul de nyid du 'jug pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba med bzhin du 'gro ba med bzhin du 'jig rten dag gis 'gro bar mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin pas 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur
analyzed: me lce dang chu rgyun la sogs pa yang gang du skyes pa'i yul de nyid du 'jug pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba med bzhin du 'gro ba med bzhin du 'jig rten dag gis 'gro bar mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin pas 'gro ba don gzhan du gyur

analyzed: pa yod par kho bo cag khas mi len to //
translated: But the world sees them as going, even though they do not go. This is an error. Therefore, we do not accept that going is a different object.ğŸ”½Since there is no going even in the ultimate, the refutation of going in the ultimate is an affirmation of what is established.

analyzed: don dam par yang 'gro ba med pas don dam par 'gro ba 'gog pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan to //

analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma pas don dam par 'gro ba dgag pa dang / lus las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba dgag pa smras pa gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag mdo sde pa'i grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su smra ba kho na yin pas de'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is what he says: â€œJust as the Madhyamikas say that going is refuted in the ultimate and that going is refuted as something other than the body, we Sautrantikas also say the same thing. Therefore, you are at fault for affirming what is already established.â€

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to this, Candrakirti says:

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis skye ba bkag pas ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //ğŸ”½dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //

original: des na khyed kyi 'dun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rtsol bas bskyed pa'i rlung gi khams las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs lus zhes bya ba yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya'o zhes 'di skad smras
analyzed: des na khyed kyi 'dun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rtsol bas bskyed pa'i rlung gi khams las 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs lus zhes bya ba yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya'o zhes 'di skad smras
translated: Since we Followers of the Middle Way refute the arising of all things on the ultimate level, we say to you Proponents of Things that your assertion that â€œthe body, which is a collection of elements and sense bases, arises in another place without interruption through the power of the wind element that is produced by the effort that arises from the intentionâ€ is not established.

original: pa'i sgrub pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i sgrub pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: because the proof of going does not exist.

original: de yang skye bo mkhas pa'i yid mgu bar byed pa ma yin no //

original: me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa de yang 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: me lce la sogs pa bzhin du 'gro ba 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa de yang 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /

analyzed: ji ltar me lce la sogs pa skye ba'i yul nyid du 'jig pa'i phyir /

analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du 'jig rten dag gis 'gro ba mthong ba ni 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: so the worldâ€™s perception of going is mistaken.ğŸ”½The cognition that the flame of a lamp arises without interruption in another place is correct cognition.

analyzed: me lce la sogs pa yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye bar shes pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhes khyed mdo sde pa dag 'dod pa'i shes pa de yang 'khrul pa'i shes pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: de yang skye bo mkhas pa'i yid mgu bar byed pa ma yin no //

original: ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba gnyis gzhan nyid du brtags pa de nyes par smras pa yin pas de bzhin du khyed kyis gzhan nyid ma yin par brtags pa de yang nyes par smras pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyis 'gro ba po dang 'gro ba gnyis gzhan nyid du brtags pa de nyes par smras pa yin pas de bzhin du khyed kyis gzhan nyid ma yin par brtags pa de yang nyes par smras pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Just as you say that the error is in the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikaâ€™s positing the goer and going as different, so too the error is in your positing them as not different.

analyzed: kho bos de don dam par 'gog par byed pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore the meaning of â€œwe refute them ultimatelyâ€ is that we do not establish what is already established.

original: grangs can dag na re /

translated: The SÄá¹ƒkhyas say:

original: ma song ba la rdul shas che zhing bya ba byed pa la 'jug par gsal bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: ma song ba la rdul shas che zhing bya ba byed pa la 'jug par gsal bar gyur pa na /
translated: When the subtle part of the dust moves on the path that has not yet been traversed, it is clear that it engages in action.

analyzed: 'gro'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag ma song ba'i lam la 'gro ba yod par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: When it is said â€œit goes,â€ the SÄá¹ƒkhyas prove that going exists on the path that has not yet been traversed.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: las kyang dbang po lnga po dag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba dag la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi yon tan gsum yod pa las /
analyzed: las kyang dbang po lnga po dag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba dag la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi yon tan gsum yod pa las /

original: gang gi tshe las kyi dbang po rkang pas ma song ba'i lam la rdul gyi rang bzhin shas che zhing 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba byed pa la 'jug pa gsal bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe las kyi dbang po rkang pas ma song ba'i lam la rdul gyi rang bzhin shas che zhing 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba byed pa la 'jug pa gsal bar gyur pa na /
translated: When the action faculty of the foot is on a path not yet traversed, if the nature of rajas is strong and the activity characterized as going engages in its function,

analyzed: ma sod ba'i lam la 'gro ba yod de rdul ni g-yo ba dang 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro ;
translated: then going exists on a path not yet traversed because rajas has the nature of movement and engagement.

original: / de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: / de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

analyzed: de dag gi yang gsal ba bkag pa'i phyir 'gro ba mi 'grub pas rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since going is not established because the manifestation of those is refuted, it is mere imagination.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /

original: ji ltar 'gro ba'i bya ba snga nas mi gsal ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang gsal bar mi byed de /ğŸ”½mi @227a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba'i bya ba snga nas mi gsal ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang gsal bar mi byed de / mi @227a * //
translated: Just as the action of going is not manifest prior to the manifest, it does not manifest in the future.

original: gsal ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas de'i phyir ma song ba la yang 'gro ba med par grub pas /
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas de'i phyir ma song ba la yang 'gro ba med par grub pas /
translated: Because it is not manifest, like a sky flower, therefore it is established that there is no going where one has not gone.

original: 'gro ba yod par brtags pa ni rtog pa tsam du zad do /ğŸ”½// / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par brtags pa ni rtog pa tsam du zad do / // / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /
translated: Therefore the imagination that going exists is mere imagination.

original: ci ste yang 'gro ba smra ba dag ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi 'jigs pas bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par dam bcas na ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'gro ba smra ba dag ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi 'jigs pas bgom pa la 'gro ba yod par dam bcas na ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med do snyam na /
translated: If, fearing the previously explained faults, the proponents of going say that going exists on that being gone over, then the previously explained faults do not arise.

original: slob dpon gyis don de nges par mdzad nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis don de nges par mdzad nas /
translated: The master, having ascertained the meaning of that, says:

translated: Since there is no going apart from that over which one has gone, that over which one has not gone, and that over which one goes, it is said:

analyzed: song dang ma song ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from that over which one has gone and that over which one has not gone,

original: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bgom pa zhes bya ba nyid med par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bgom pa zhes bya ba nyid med par ston to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that that over which one goes does not exist.

original: gzung du med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni bgom pa zhes bya ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung du med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni bgom pa zhes bya ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œit is not apprehendedâ€ is that that over which one goes is not perceived.

original: de la bgom pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la bgom pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that over which one goes?

original: song ba'i lam la yang ma yin /
analyzed: song ba'i lam la yang ma yin /
translated: It is not on the path over which one has gone,

original: ma song ba'i lam la yang ma yin pa da ltar gom pas mnan pa'i lam gang yin pa de ni bgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma song ba'i lam la yang ma yin pa da ltar gom pas mnan pa'i lam gang yin pa de ni bgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: nor is it on the path over which one has not yet gone. That path which is being stepped on by the present step is called that over which one goes.

analyzed: de ni song ba dang ma song ba'i lam ma gtogs par de gnyis kyi bar na med do //
translated: Apart from the path over which one has gone and the path over which one has not yet gone, it does not exist between those two.

original: ji ltar de med ce na /ğŸ”½'di la bgom pa de ni song ba'am //
analyzed: ji ltar de med ce na / 'di la bgom pa de ni song ba'am //
translated: How does it not exist?

original: ma song ba'am /
analyzed: ma song ba'am /
translated: Here, that over which one goes is either that over which one has gone,ğŸ”½or that over which one has not yet gone,ğŸ”½or that over which one goes.

original: gang cung zad ni song cung zad ni ma song ba gnyi ga zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: gang cung zad ni song cung zad ni ma song ba gnyi ga zhig yin grang na /
translated: If it is both that over which one has gone and that over which one has not gone,

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bgom pa med par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bgom pa med par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: then there is the fault of the reductio that has been demonstrated in both cases.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gis bgom pa yod par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gis bgom pa yod par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa yin no //
translated: Here, â€œit is saidâ€ means that the assertion of arising is said in order to establish that that over which one has gone exists.

original: bgom pa med pa ma yin te //
analyzed: bgom pa med pa ma yin te //
translated: That over which one has gone does not not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba ma yin te /
translated: This means that it is not non-apparent,

original: yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it exists.ğŸ”½Thus:

original: 'di ltar / gang na g-yo ba de na 'gro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang na g-yo ba de na 'gro //
translated: Where there is motion, there is going.

original: de yang gang gi bgom pa la //
analyzed: de yang gang gi bgom pa la //
translated: And that is on that over which one has gone.

original: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
analyzed: g-yo ba song min ma song min //
translated: Motion is not where one has gone, nor where one has not gone.

original: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod //
analyzed: de phyir bgom la 'gro ba yod //
translated: Therefore, where one has gone, there is going.

original: ces bya ba 'di ni phyogs snga ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di ni phyogs snga ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa yin no //
translated: This is the verse of the opponent.

original: de la phyogs gang na rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba snang ba de na 'gro ba yod de zhes bya ba ni bgom pas phyogs gang na rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba snang ba'i phyogs de na
analyzed: de la phyogs gang na rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba snang ba de na 'gro ba yod de zhes bya ba ni bgom pas phyogs gang na rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba snang ba'i phyogs de na

original: 'gro ba yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa ste /
translated: Where there is the appearance of movement that has the characteristic of lifting and lowering the foot, there going exists.

original: g-yo ba dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Movement and going are synonymous.

original: g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi / g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi @227b snang ma song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi / g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi @227b snang ma song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Movement appears on that being gone over, but it does not appear on that being gone over and that not being gone over. Therefore going exists on that being gone over.

original: bgom pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gom pas mnan pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: bgom pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gom pas mnan pa'i lam ste /
translated: That being gone over is the path that is being stepped on by the foot.

original: da la rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba dang 'gro ba snang bas des na 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: da la rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi g-yo ba dang 'gro ba snang bas des na 'gro ba yod do //
translated: Since movement and going appear on that being gone over, therefore going exists.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam la g-yo ba de snang bas de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir bgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam la g-yo ba de snang bas de'i phyir bgom pa la 'gro ba yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: Moreover, that movement appears on that being gone over, but that movement does not appear on that being gone over. Therefore, since that movement appears on the path called â€œbeing gone over,â€ therefore going exists on that being gone over.

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de ltar slob dpon nyid kyis kyang //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon nyid kyis kyang //
translated: The master himself also explains this as follows:

original: 'di la gang na g-yo ba snang ba de la 'gro ba yod de /
analyzed: 'di la gang na g-yo ba snang ba de la 'gro ba yod de /
translated: Where movement appears, there going exists.

original: g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi / g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi snang ma song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: g-yo ba de yang gang gi phyir bgom pa la snang gi / g-yo ba de song ba la yang mi snang ma song ba la yang mi snang ba de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, that movement appears on that being gone over, but that movement does not appear on that being gone over, nor does it appear on that not yet gone over.

original: bgom pa la 'gro ba yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bgom pa la 'gro ba yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, going does not exist on that being gone over.

original: des na de ltar bgom pa yod pas 'gro ba 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa grub po zhes bya ba ni de ltar bgom pa yod pas de la 'gro ba yod pa 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de ltar bgom pa yod pas 'gro ba 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa grub po zhes bya ba ni de ltar bgom pa yod pas de la 'gro ba yod pa 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since that being gone over exists, going is established. Therefore, the assertion is established.

original: kho bo cag gi 'dod pa don gyi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te /ğŸ”½de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi 'dod pa don gyi dngos po rnams skyes pa kho na yin te / de dag gi yul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: We assert that things are only produced,

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: because they are the objects of conventions.
